Title: ML Engineer
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ready to shape the future at the cutting edge of AI and neuroscience?

At Neurons, we're not just building technology - we're transforming the way the world understands human decision-making. We're looking for bold thinkers to help design and deploy machine learning models fueled by biometric, neurometric, and psychometric data. You’ll also help craft powerful AI workflows using generative and multi-modal models that push boundaries and unlock real-world impact.

You'll work closely with passionate, cross-functional teams, turning ideas into scalable solutions for some of the world’s biggest brands. All within a culture that champions curiosity, collaboration, and personal growth.

If you're driven by innovation, excited to explore uncharted territory, and ready to build the future - let’s talk!

Interested? Then keep on reading!

Your key responsibilities:


Architect and build advanced AI solutions using multi-process workflows powered by generative AI and multi-modal models, driving innovation within Neurons AI.
Design, train, and deploy machine learning models that utilize biometric, neurometric, and psychometric data to solve real-world challenges in neuroscience and marketing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI solutions into our platform, ensuring they are scalable, reliable, and meet client needs.
Stay at the forefront of AI advancements - especially in generative AI and neuroscience - to continuously enhance the impact and performance of our technology.


What we're looking for:


Strong proficiency in Python and experience with key frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, and Keras.
Hands-on experience with generative AI technologies, including building multi-process workflows, integrating multi-modal LLMs, and designing effective LLM evaluation frameworks.
Comfortable with version control (Git) and Docker. Experience with CI/CD pipelines, cloud platforms (especially GCP), REST APIs, MLOps workflows, or Terraform is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Proven experience - or strong motivation to learn - best practices in writing production-quality code with a focus on maintainability, security, and performance.
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.


Join the Neurons Movement!

In our inclusive culture, innovation flourishes. We believe true progress comes from being yourself, sharing ideas freely, and collaborating with inspiring colleagues. So if you're all about the above, come help us redefine consumer neuroscience!

Innovation at our Core: Our 11-year legacy began with neuroscientist and bestselling author, Dr. Thomas Zoëga Ramsøy, a leading figure in the fields of applied neuroscience, consumer neuroscience, and neuromarketing. Innovation continues to drive everything we do, from our CEO to each and every team member, we push boundaries and foster forward-thinking, leveraging data and AI to transform our industry.

Team Spirit and Culture: We’re committed to fostering a culture that values teamwork and personal growth. Building something extraordinary requires effective collaboration and top talent. So why not surround yourself with a supportive team that drives success!

Results with Empathy: We’re focused on achieving results while also prioritizing empathy. Join a culture that balances ambition with consideration and where continuous feedback on performance and development is encouraged. Here, success is measured not just in numbers, but in relationships, collaboration, and positive impact.

Diverse and Inclusive: Our team of 80 talents from 30 nations proudly celebrates diversity. By embracing diversity and individual development, we believe that we can achieve sustainable growth and remain committed to fostering a culture where people of all backgrounds feel welcomed.

At Neurons, the journey is as exciting as the destination. Experience a career where innovation, teamwork, and meaningful results come together in ways you've never imagined!

We offer an array of benefits

We are a company that takes pride in the health & well-being of all our employees, with initiatives such as yoga practice, healthy breaks, and mental health resources.

We enjoy coming together for our Friday Hygge, where you might find us singing karaoke, playing bingo, video games or board games.

Other benefits include:


In-house lunch
Pension Plan
Private Health insurance
Parental leave benefits
Workstation (including necessary equipment)
Quarterly company events
Team Events

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist







Location: Copenhagen

Job Type: full-time







Assist organizations worldwide in implementing Responsible AI  




Are you a highly ambitious and motivated Data Scientist interested in positively impacting the world with AI technology that you develop and deliver to clients worldwide?  If so, you might be the new colleague we at 2021.AI are looking for! 




2021.AI seeks a motivated Data Scientist to join our highly-skilled team of Data Scientists, working at the forefront of solving business challenges using statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, data engineering, etc.. In this role, you will participate in data science projects and deliveries. In addition, you will assist in the future development of different AI / ML and technology services on our GRACE platform. 




About You




You have high ambitions and want to positively impact the world with the AI / ML technology you develop and deliver to clients globally. This shines through in your ability to use statistical modeling, machine learning engineering, and data engineering skills to deliver impactful and valuable business solutions across different industries in the private and public sectors.




You are independent, driven, motivated, and solution-oriented.




You work well with others. This entails teamwork with your internal team and with clients on- and off-site.




Your expertise is with data science, AI/ML, and related technologies, and you are passionate about delivering AI/ML solutions all the way from initial ML model research to implementing the working model in production. 




You have experience in independently developing AI/ML, statistical models, or LLMs that solve particular business challenges, including the process of preparing the models for deployment and production.




You are interested in working with one of the best data science teams on the planet, technology rock stars, and business magnates, all dedicated to responsibly and positively impacting the future with AI. 




About the Role




As a Data Scientist at 2021.AI, you will make your mark and directly influence the direction of data science in 2021.AI while delivering value with AI and ML to our partners and clients. 




You will participate as a Data Scientist in client projects and work closely with other teams in 2021.AI to improve our core product features and demonstrate product value to clients on the GRACE Platform.




Key Responsibilities




Take part in projects developing AI and ML models for clients and partners
Embed those actions and insights into integrations and solutions for our clients’ businesses
Develop high-quality models with the business value in mind
Bring business objectives to the center of the ML development process




Skills and Qualifications:




M.Sc. or equivalent in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
2-3 years of hands-on, practical experience
Solid experience in Python programming combined with a mathematical/theoretical foundation in statistical modeling
Experience in writing production-ready Python code
Data manipulation and visualization skills, including database handling and data cleaning/management
ML Engineering experience related to the implementation and deployment of AI and ML into production via, e.g., FastAPI or Docker
Knowledge in LLMs, including RAG construction and prompt engineering
Full working knowledge of English
Fast learning and a proactive mindset
Excellent presentation skills both toward business leaders and technical experts
Exceptional human and superb collaboration skills

Extra consideration is given to candidates with: 




The ability to identify potential use cases to create business value for our customers
Experience building LLM agents using tools such as LangGraph and LangSmith.




About 2021.AI 




Founded in Copenhagen with several offices worldwide, 2021.AI is a fast-growing AI company focused on closing the gap between AI ambitions and real AI value for companies worldwide. Large private and public organizations globally trust us to help them stay competitive, compliant, and in control when applying AI. 




We are a team of passionate people who care deeply about the mission we are on; to positively impact the future with AI. Our tight-knit culture of camaraderie instills more than just a sense of belonging but great pride in our work. With high cultural ambitions, we expect you to bring lots of energy to the workplace and participate in company-related and social activities. In return, we promise great professional experiences and the freedom to tackle and own your tasks.




Supporting you professionally and personally

Professional Growth: Your CV will tell us where you've been, but we are also interested in where you want to go. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. We trust our team members and give them autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development and provide regular feedback.
Meaningful Impact: In our company, every job matters, and you can see almost daily that you are making a meaningful impact. Our feedback loops are fast, which means you will have the opportunity to learn and advance quickly, growing together with the company. 
Outstanding Team: Our AI platform GRACE helps companies and people cooperate across the board, and we apply this mindset to our team. We have a highly collaborative, no-bureaucracy culture. 
Excellent Benefits: We offer competitive pay, a healthcare benefits package, and a positive work-life balance.
For Copenhagen employees, we provide the corporate equipment you need, flexible working hours, team buildings, a fantastic office location in Nørrebro, Friday bars, coffee, laughs, and cutting-edge industry knowledge!







2021.AI is an equal opportunity company. We welcome all applicants, no matter their race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, criminal prosecution, judgment in a criminal case, or any other characteristic protected by law.




Questions & Support? Let’s connect. Please contact us: careers@2021.ai




Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?

AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—

Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modelling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+ etc.

AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 100+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do

You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with nine other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Product department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.




This role is heavily focused on programming and model development, with approximately 80% programming and 20% math/statistics. While we use standard libraries for utilities, we rarely rely on high-level, pre-built model functions. Instead, our team develops models from first principles, focusing on algorithmic design and mathematical/statistical foundations.

While we appreciate diverse backgrounds, this position is not aligned with business analytics, qualitative research, or linguistics-focused skill sets.




Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, etc.). Candidates with a social science background, but specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create valuable insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, for example descriptive statistics, time series analysis, and regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and classical machine learning models, with a focus on understanding the underlying principles.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analysing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioural data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and analysis and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages and creates value for customers.
Coding hobby projects. We are interested in seeing what kind of programming related hobbies you have, or what kind of coding projects you have done in your spare time. This can be shared through a link in your CV/Cover letter.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer

A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application

If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




Apply via Linkedin attaching the following into ONE DOCUMENT:

CV
Cover letter
Copy of graduation certificates for both educations, with grade transcripts
Remember to include a reference/link to your coding hobby project in your CV or cover letter, if relevant




Attention: applications and documents sent via email will not be considered.

We are only considering candidates who are already based in Copenhagen, as we are unable to offer relocation support for this position.

You can only apply once to this position through Linkedin, so make sure to have all your documents condensed into ONE document.




The deadline for applications is August 17th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.

We look forward to receiving your application!

HTML:
Are you our new Data Scientist?

AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—

Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modelling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+ etc.

AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 100+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.


Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach their audiences more effectively.


Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.


Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.


What you will do

You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.


In the Data Science Research team, you will work with nine other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Product department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.


This role is heavily focused on programming and model development, with approximately 80% programming and 20% math/statistics. While we use standard libraries for utilities, we rarely rely on high-level, pre-built model functions. Instead, our team develops models from first principles, focusing on algorithmic design and mathematical/statistical foundations.

While we appreciate diverse backgrounds, this position is not aligned with business analytics, qualitative research, or linguistics-focused skill sets.


Essential qualifications

  • You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, etc.). Candidates with a social science background, but specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
  • You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create valuable insights.
  • You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, for example descriptive statistics, time series analysis, and regression analyses.
  • You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
  • You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
  • You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

  • Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and classical machine learning models, with a focus on understanding the underlying principles.
  • Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analysing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioural data.
  • An ability to understand the business implications of data and analysis and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages and creates value for customers.
  • Coding hobby projects. We are interested in seeing what kind of programming related hobbies you have, or what kind of coding projects you have done in your spare time. This can be shared through a link in your CV/Cover letter.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.


What we offer

A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.

  • Competitive salary
  • Pension scheme and health insurance
  • Home internet paid
  • Central Copenhagen office
  • Hybrid work model
  • Daily breakfast
  • Lunch made by an on-site chef
  • Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
  • Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
  • International environment
  • Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
  • Innovative and market-leading products and services
  • Exposure to a lot of data handling
  • Technically/commercially challenging tasks
  • Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
  • Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry


Send us your application

If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.


Apply via Linkedin attaching the following into ONE DOCUMENT:

  • CV
  • Cover letter
  • Copy of graduation certificates for both educations, with grade transcripts
  • Remember to include a reference/link to your coding hobby project in your CV or cover letter, if relevant


Attention: applications and documents sent via email will not be considered.

We are only considering candidates who are already based in Copenhagen, as we are unable to offer relocation support for this position.

You can only apply once to this position through Linkedin, so make sure to have all your documents condensed into ONE document.


The deadline for applications is August 17th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Veo you will get to work on challenging problems and directly contribute to the value created by our AI-driven end-user products.

You will become part of our AI team, which comprises 15 researchers and engineers responsible for all stages in the machine learning lifecycles across different projects - from scoping and defining data annotation tasks to modeling, validation, and deployment. You will be free to determine the directions of the project you work on while also getting feedback and being encouraged to spar with the rest of the team to assist each other in improving and succeeding.

We stay current with the latest research and continuously discuss concepts and ideas in recent papers to assess their relevance to our tasks and product-specific challenges.

We are looking to add yet another ambitious, high-performing junior to senior engineer/researcher with proven experience from real-world machine learning projects to the team. Experience with computer vision is advantageous but not a must.

What you will do:



Train state-of-the-art machine learning models
Write efficient inference pipelines for cloud and edge
Define and supervise data annotation tasks
Improve evaluation schemes to increase understanding of model performance and shortcomings
Contribute to long-term planning and prioritization of tasks




What you will need:



MSc or PhD in a relevant field
Hands-on experience with real-world, large-scale machine-learning projects
Great coding skills
Skilled at both autonomous tasks and contributing to group efforts
Ability to examine details closely and critically




At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, develop, train, and evaluate deep learning models (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, etc.)
Collaborate with data scientists to understand business requirements and translate them into robust ML solutions
Optimize models for inference (e.g., quantization, pruning, ONNX, TensorRT)
Deploy models to production environments (e.g., via REST APIs, edge devices, or cloud platforms)
Conduct data preprocessing, augmentation, and exploratory data analysis
Maintain and improve MLOps pipelines for training, testing, and monitoring
Document experiments, results, and best practices for future reference

Requirements

Proven experience (3+ years) in deep learning and model deployment
Strong proficiency in Python and DL frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Familiarity with model versioning, reproducibility, and experiment tracking (MLflow, Weights & Biases)
Strong understanding of data structures, computer vision or NLP (depending on the project)
Solid background in mathematics/statistics (linear algebra, probability, optimization)
Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in a cross-functional team

Title: Student Data Scientist (ML)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a student interested in data and ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges? At Danske Bank, we’re looking for a Student Assistant in Data Science to join our Customer Intelligence team — where we use data and machine learning to better understand and serve our customers.

You’ll support projects that shape how we personalize experiences, predict customer needs, and drive smarter marketing and service decisions.

💼 What You’ll Do

As part of a skilled and supportive team, you’ll assist with a range of tasks that support the development and deployment of machine learning models for retail banking use cases:


Help prepare and explore customer data (transactional, behavioral, demographic)
Support ongoing work on churn prediction, propensity modelling, segmentation, and CLV estimation
Run exploratory analyses and assist with feature engineering and data validation
Contribute to internal documentation, data quality checks, and model evaluation
Learn about model governance, responsible AI, and data-driven decision-making in banking
Work closely with experienced data scientists in an environment focused on learning and collaboration


📚 What We’re Looking For


You’re currently enrolled in a relevant degree (e.g., Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics with a quantitative focus)
You have a strong interest in machine learning, customer behavior, and applied data analytics
You’re comfortable with Python and familiar with tools like pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn
You’re proactive, analytical, and curious — with a willingness to learn and contribute
You can commit to working 15–20 hours per week alongside your studies


💡 Nice To Have (But Not Required)


Experience working with real-world datasets in a project or internship
Familiarity with SQL, cloud platforms (e.g., Azure), or MLOps tools
Interest in retail banking, financial services, or digital marketing analytics


🌟 What We Offer


A hands-on opportunity to work with real customer data in a leading bank
A friendly and collaborative team culture that values learning and development
Flexible working hours tailored to your academic schedule
The chance to see how AI and data science are used in a highly regulated, customer-focused industry
Working in our new HQ with great facilities


📩 Interested?

Please apply for the position by submitting your CV and cover letter through our careers page or LinkedIn ! Let’s build the future of AI together!

First interviews will take place in August, so don’t hold back!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist 6 Months Contract
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Senior AI Consultant to join a cross-functional AI initiative within a major financial institution. The role focuses on designing, building, and deploying scalable and reliable AI solutions that address commercial challenges such as recommendation systems, churn prediction, and other advanced use cases.

You will be part of a collaborative, outcome-driven team working across the full AI lifecycle—from ideation and prototyping to industrialization and production deployment.

Key Responsibilities


Co-design and develop end-to-end AI solutions with internal teams
Work with complex business problems and turn them into technical use cases
Build, test, train, and deploy machine learning models in production environments
Engage with stakeholders across the full AI lifecycle
Act as a technical advisor and solution enabler within the team



Must-Have Skills & Qualifications


Deep knowledge of the AI/ML tech stack and advanced ML techniques
Full lifecycle experience: from proof-of-concept to production-ready models
Proven delivery record of AI use cases in large enterprises
Hands-on experience working in regulated environments (e.g., banking, insurance)
Background in solution-focused consultancy roles
Excellent communication, storytelling, and stakeholder management skills
5+ years of professional experience in data science / machine learning
Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in computer science, machine learning, applied mathematics, or similar field
Fluent in English (written and spoken)



Nice-to-Have


Experience with financial services, though not mandatory
Familiarity with AI governance or explainability frameworks



Requirements


Personal Attributes


Solution-oriented and collaborative
Busines


Languages


English

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Engineers (x2) – Product-Led Startup

60,000–80,000 DKK/month

Copenhagen (Hybrid – 3 to 4 days/week in office)




We’re helping a well-backed AI startup scale their core engineering team with two new hires – hands-on AI engineers who can contribute across the stack and help bring multiple live products to the next level.




This is a small, senior team where you’ll be working directly with founders, shipping production features fast, and playing a meaningful role in shaping the product and tech direction.




What we’re looking for:

Engineers with a strong product mindset and experience in fast-moving environments
Solid exposure to LLMs, RAG workflows, vector databases, or frameworks like Langchain
Comfortable working in .NET and React, but tech isn't everything – mindset is key
Cloud-first thinking – you’ve built and shipped systems, not just hooked into them
No freelancers or short-termers – we’re looking for people who’ve grown with a company




Tech environment:

RAG, Langchain, vector DBs
.NET
React




Even if you do not feel like you tick all of the boxes, please still apply - we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist PredAI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for multiple data scientists or machine learning engineers focusing on generative AI for text, and Large Language Models.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

What you’ll be doing:


Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications
Keep up to date with the latest AI developments to shape our Gen AI best practices and tooling
Document models and processes to ensure compliance and meet our compliance and risk management standards


The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki.

Who You Are

This is the right role if you have a passion to solve challenging problems - with the help of data, software and AI. As a person, you look past the noise, to do what is right. You prefer action to talking, but when you talk, people want to listen.

Your experience and background:


MSc or PhD in a field related to predictive or statistical modelling.
At least 2 years’ experience developing machine learning solutions in python, with a focus on model validation and explainability in a production grade system.
Exposure to multiple predictive AI projects, either through work or Kaggle or similar.
A knack for tackling complex problems and creating simple solutions.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas and technology across domains.


It would be ideal if you also:


Experience from working on AWS
Experience developing production grade code


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Björn Hertzberg (bjorn.hertzberg@nordea.com)

The recruitment process consists of the following steps:


Preliminary CV selection
Phone conversation with the recruiter
Online interview with the hiring leader
Background check


We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

For candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

For candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
Show more
HTML:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for multiple data scientists or machine learning engineers focusing on generative AI for text, and Large Language Models.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
  • Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
  • Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications
  • Keep up to date with the latest AI developments to shape our Gen AI best practices and tooling
  • Document models and processes to ensure compliance and meet our compliance and risk management standards

The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki.

Who You Are

This is the right role if you have a passion to solve challenging problems - with the help of data, software and AI. As a person, you look past the noise, to do what is right. You prefer action to talking, but when you talk, people want to listen.

Your experience and background:

  • MSc or PhD in a field related to predictive or statistical modelling.
  • At least 2 years’ experience developing machine learning solutions in python, with a focus on model validation and explainability in a production grade system.
  • Exposure to multiple predictive AI projects, either through work or Kaggle or similar.
  • A knack for tackling complex problems and creating simple solutions.
  • Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas and technology across domains.

It would be ideal if you also:

  • Experience from working on AWS
  • Experience developing production grade code

What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Björn Hertzberg (bjorn.hertzberg@nordea.com)

The recruitment process consists of the following steps:

  • Preliminary CV selection
  • Phone conversation with the recruiter
  • Online interview with the hiring leader
  • Background check

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

For candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

For candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
*** NEW ROLE - SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - COPENHAGEN BASED ***




Are you currently looking for a new role?




DVF Recruitment are currently supporting a global consultancy business look to hire a talented Senior Data Scientist.




My client are looking for an individual that has the following:




3-5+ years of working experience in areas such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence.
Strong hands-on experience and understanding of processing unstructured (text) data, using Large Language Models (LLMs).
Experience working for a consultancy (must)
English communication skills (Danish is a big plus)




This is a full time role based in Copenhagen. The salary for this role has been kept the as it will depend on experience/ technical capability.




Apply to find out more!

Title: Data Scientist med AI/ML-fokus til EWIIs Digitale Kundeplatforme
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en energikoncern der leverer vand og fjernvarme i trekantområdet samt el, bredbånd og ladeløsninger til kunder i hele Danmark. Vi har inden for de seneste år udskiftet alle vores digitale kundevendte platforme, og har nu en stærk digital tilstedeværelse med vores hjemmeside, flere selvbetjeningsløsninger, mobilapps og en marketing automation platform. Platformene er integrerede med hinanden og bygget på en moderne og prisbelønnet integrationsplatform, hvor data er gjort tilgængelige via microservices.

I Digitale Kundeplatforme drifter og videreudvikler vi platformene i tæt samarbejde med andre forretningsområder og vores eget tilknyttede IT-udviklingsteam. Vi er allerede i gang med at implementere databaserede løsninger, som en del af vores digitale kundeoplevelser, og ønsker nu at tage næste skridt og sætte fart på udviklingen.

Om rollen

Du bliver teamets specialist i machine learning og AI og får ansvar for at udvikle, teste og implementere modeller, der udgør det datamæssige fundament for nye digitale løsninger og services til vores kunder.

Du kommer til at arbejde hands-on med modellering, databehandling og kode – i tæt samspil med relevante afdelinger såsom IT-infrastruktur, Data Warehouse og Data Governance. Derudover vil du arbejde sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet, der arbejder med app, web, selvbetjening og marketing automation, om at integrere modellerne direkte i vores digitale platforme og løsninger, så de skaber reel værdi for vores kunder.

Hos EWII arbejder andre data scientists med forskellige formål på tværs af organisationen, og vi har allerede et stærkt teknologi- og datasetup på plads. I denne rolle får du ansvar for at udvikle modeller baseret på kundernes forbrugs- og adfærdsdata – kombineret med relevante tredjepartsdata såsom vejr- og boligdata.

Eksempler på arbejdsopgaver



Udvikling og optimering af prædiktive og præskriptive modeller, som danner udgangspunkt for vores automatiserede kommunikation
Udvikling og optimering af forbrugsalarmer baseret på machine learning og anomalidetektion, som automatisk kan opdage, hvis den enkelte kundes forbrug afviger fra deres normalforbrug
Udvikling af personaliserede forbrugsrapporter baseret på dataanalyse og integreret med generativt AI, som genererer individuelle rapporter med grafer og forklarende tekst.
Udforske nye teknologier og eksperimentere med ML- og AI-baserede løsninger på tværs af platformene.



Det tilbyder vi 

Som medarbejder i EWII er det ikke kun dit arbejde, der er i centrum - du får også mange personalegoder, der er værd at arbejde for. Hvilke goder, du kan nyde godt af, kan du blive klogere på her. 

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende – fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et ønske om at arbejde tættere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi lægger vægt på, at du:



Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede miljøer, herunder udvikling af prædiktive og preskriptive modeller på Azure Databricks-platformen.
Har stærke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
Forstår, hvordan modeller omsættes til værdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvstændigt ansvar for dit ansvarsområde, men sætter pris på at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores fælles vision og mål.



I rollen får du



En central rolle i et ambitiøst digitalt team med stærkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne idéer til ML- og AI-baserede kundeløsninger
Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus på digital innovation.



Sæt et grønt fodspor sammen med os 

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men fælles for alle er, at fagligheden når helt ud i fingerspidserne – og den skal male fremtiden grøn. 

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag – uanset om vi lægger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over på fiber. Sammen gør vi det, der er sort til grøn business – til gavn for miljø, kunder og bundlinje. 

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ansøgning ved at klikke på ansøgningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ansøgninger velkomne uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.  

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, så kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, på tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan læse mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads på ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du også følge med ovre på LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram. 

Stillingen besættes hurtigst muligt, og du kan søge den, så længe den er online på ewii.dk. Vi forventer at afholde de første samtaler i uge 32 og 33.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Place: Hillerød Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Machine Learning Scientist




FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled machine learning scientist with a strong background in deep learning to develop our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.




This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSS’ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately better global usage of limited resources.










Primary tasks




Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for the data chain. You will work in close collaboration with our hardware and software teams as well as marketing organization in taking the data chain from concept to deployment and sales release. In this task, you will be responsible for:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets.
Develop algorithms and data pipelines.
Design experiments to test the data chain.
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets.
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms.




Your daily work will be at the FOSS innovation center in Hillerød, Denmark.







About you




You hold an M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:

Extensive hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Proficient in data science methodologies, including experimental design, statistical analysis, and hypothesis testing, using tools such as Python, Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
Experience in machine learning development best-practices and MLOps workflows.
Good understanding of image processing, with practical use of libraries such as OpenCV.
Familiar with optimizing deep learning models for efficient deployment on edge devices and resource constrained environments is a plus.
Previous industry experience in applied machine learning projects is considered an advantage.




We expect you to have an interest in

the full data chain of analytical instruments.
developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers.
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain.










As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You’re curious about new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting, incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open-minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.







We offer




We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D. Foss is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strives at delivering cutting-edge creative algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal and humorous tone.




Application




Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, but due to summer vacation in Denmark, the hiring process will start in week 31! Any questions can be directed to head of machine learning Erik Schou Dreier esd@foss.dk (please note there may be a slight delay in response due to vacation).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief.




FOSS

FOSS contributes to the sustainable use of our planet’s agricultural resources and thus to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We make it our business to build analytical solutions, which add value by improving food quality and optimizing production, from raw material to finished products.

FOSS helps optimize the use of food and agricultural resources by enabling customers to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste, better quality, bigger yields, and more optimal use of raw materials.

Always at the forefront of analytical technology development, FOSS provides a range of analytical solutions from laboratory to at-line and in-line solutions, across industries from dairy to grain and meat.

FOSS provides instruments and solutions to the world’s 100 largest food companies and for more than 60 years, FOSS has been innovating analytical technology.

FOSS was founded by Nils Foss in Hillerød in 1956. We are a family-owned, global company and our products and services are sold all around the world. FOSS employs more than 1,500 highly qualified people worldwide.

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

HTML:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
  • Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
  • CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
  • Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
  • Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
  • Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
  • Example Tasks

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
  • You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Our client is looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Python Developer to join their development team. You will be responsible for building scalable, efficient, and robust backend systems and applications using Python.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, test, and deploy backend applications using Python.
Build and integrate APIs, third-party services, and database solutions.
Write clean, reusable, and well-documented code following best practices.
Optimize applications for performance, scalability, and reliability.
Debug and troubleshoot issues across development, testing, and production environments.
Collaborate with front-end developers, product managers, and QA teams to deliver high-quality solutions.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to team knowledge sharing.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies, frameworks, and industry trends.




Qualifications & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
1–3 years of hands-on experience in Python development.
Solid understanding of core Python concepts and frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
Experience working with RESTful APIs, JSON, and web services.
Proficient in working with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and/or NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
Experience with testing tools and writing unit/integration tests.
Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in an Agile environment.







We are fully GDPR compliant and take your privacy seriously. Your data is never sold to third parties. You may receive marketing emails from our company group only.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Machine Learning)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you ready to redefine how customers experience banking through data-driven insights and personalization? At Danske Bank, we’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to drive the development of machine learning models that power smarter engagement, proactive retention, and tailored financial advice towards our customers.

This role is an unique opportunity to make a direct impact on millions of customers by turning behavioral data into predictive insights that shape how we communicate, serve, and grow our relationships.

👥 Who Are We

The Commercial Data Science CoE is a diverse team of Data Scientists, ML Engineers and MLOps Engineers with various educational and cultural backgrounds. We are responsible for applying AI in Danske Bank’s customer facing solutions, ranging anywhere from ML models used for personalisation and marketing optimisation to chatbots and advisor assistants.

We pride ourselves on being at the forefront of the latest technology and research identifying use cases where AI can be applied to create value for customers and the bank.

💼 What You’ll Do

As a key player in our Customer AI team, you’ll lead the development of high-impact models that enable our marketing and CRM functions to deliver relevant, timely, and effective customer interactions:


Build propensity models to predict likelihood of product uptake (e.g., mortgage, investment, credit card)
Design customer segmentation frameworks for targeting, lifecycle management, and personalization
Develop churn prediction models to proactively identify at-risk customers and trigger retention actions
Estimate and optimize customer lifetime value (CLV) to inform product prioritization, pricing, and targeting
Apply uplift modeling and causal inference to evaluate marketing treatment effects and campaign ROI
Collaborate with Marketing, Digital, and Personal Banking teams to activate models in real-time journeys
Work with Data Engineering to improve the customer data foundation and feature store
Contribute to our model governance and risk management standards in compliance with banking regulation


📊 What You Bring


5+ years of experience in data science or machine learning, ideally within financial services or customer analytics
Deep understanding of predictive modeling techniques and experience applying them to customer behavior
Hands-on expertise in Python (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost), SQL, and cloud-based data platforms
Experience building and validating models using customer transactional, behavioral, and channel data
Strong business acumen in retail banking: understanding of financial products, customer lifecycles, and marketing dynamics
Ability to communicate model insights clearly to stakeholders across both technical and non-technical teams
Familiarity with GDPR, model explainability, and regulatory compliance in model development


🌟 Nice to Have


Experience with marketing automation or personalization platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Adobe, Pega)
Familiarity with uplift modeling, causal ML, or reinforcement learning for offer optimization
Experience deploying models into production using MLOps tools (e.g., MLflow, Airflow, Docker, Azure ML)
Knowledge of CLM (customer lifecycle management), cross-sell strategy, or omni-channel personalization


🚀 Why Join Us?


Help shape how the bank interacts with its customers using advanced analytics and AI
Join a growing, ambitious AI team working at the core of our digital transformation
Collaborate across an agile and business-oriented organization
Working in our new HQ with great facilities


📩 Interested?

Apply now or reach out to Rasmus Gansted Brink – RBRI@danskebank.dk for more information. Let’s build the future of AI together.

First interviews will take place in August, so don’t hold back!

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer - Skatteguiden




Tech-first. Ego-free. User-obsessed. We’re Skatteguiden – the independent advisor for 1 million Danes (and counting), starting with tax and now taking on the broader world of personal finance.




We’re not tied to strategic partners, investor KPIs or slow-moving hierarchies. We're profitable, well-funded, and accountable only to our users. That gives us a rare superpower: clarity.




We’re a tech company at heart. That means tight teams, direct execution, and continuous delivery. We build fast, break well, and learn obsessively. We ship meaningful products, not fluff – and we win together.







About This Opportunity for AI Engineer




We’re on a mission to make private economy simple — starting with taxes and now expanding across the entire private economy.




To support the growth of our AI efforts, we’re looking for a full-time AI Engineer to join us in Copenhagen — helping us bring the same clarity and simplicity to personal finance that we’ve already delivered in tax, and make it easier for people to understand and navigate their personal finances.




Our AI Tax Assistant has already handled close to 100,000 tax-related conversations since January, helping users get answers and guidance instantly.




We’re now ready to take our use of AI to the next level by designing and deploying intelligent AI agents and ML-driven products — capable of delivering contextual guidance, user interactions, and unlocking entirely new experiences across personal finance.




You’ll lead efforts to design and deploy AI/ML pipelines and LLM-powered agents — unlocking new, intelligent features across the private economy. You’ll be part of a small, focused, cross-functional squad (Product, Backend, Frontend, UX) working towards a shared goal.




You’ll work closely with our Data Product Lead, who brings deep user, data product, and transaction data understanding. Together, you’ll scope, build, and deploy AI solutions that help people understand and improve their private economy — offering insights, nudges, and personalized guidance based on real financial behaviour.




You’ll also collaborate with our current AI Engineer to enhance our AI Tax Assistant, improve its intelligence and contextual relevance, and jointly work on foundational infrastructure such as:




Creating infrastructure for our LLM MCP server
Designing ML workflow architecture
Setting up a modern and scalable ML platform




With nearly 1 million users in Denmark, our platform already serves a large share of the population. Your work will directly impact people’s financial lives — bringing clarity, relevance, and everyday guidance to those who need it most.







Key Responsibilities




Design and Build AI Solutions: Develop AI-driven models and algorithms from scratch, focusing on intelligent transaction data processing and enrichment.
Integrate AI into Product Workflows: Build features powered by AI components (e.g. LLMs, vector embeddings, classifiers) that seamlessly plug into user-facing products and back-end systems.
Own the Full Lifecycle: Take end-to-end ownership — from scoping and prototyping, to deployment, testing, and iteration.
Work with Real Systems, Not Just Models: Ensure your solutions are well-integrated into existing systems, business logic, and user journeys, with robust data flow and performance.
Collaborate Broadly: Work closely with the Data Product Lead, AI Engineer, Dev engineers, and designers to align AI development with user value and organisational priorities.
Maintain and Evolve: Actively test, maintain, and improve AI features over time, and contribute ideas for improving our overall AI setup, architecture, and capabilities.
Stay Ahead: Keep up with the evolving AI landscape and propose improvements to systems, workflows, or tooling where relevant.







Your Experience




Practical AI Experience: You’ve worked with AI technologies like LLMs and prompt engineering — ideally in product-oriented contexts.
ML modelling capabilities: You have experience with the "classical ML workflow"; collecting data, feature engineering, model selection and parameter tuning. Much work these days is done using LLM models, but you should also have experience working with other areas within the AI field.
Engineering Craft: You can design and implement scalable systems, with strong coding skills in Python (Java or similar languages also welcome).
Data Infrastructure Awareness: You understand how data moves and how AI systems depend on clean, structured input and effective deployment environments.
Lead with Ownership: You're comfortable taking the lead on complex problems, balancing experimentation with delivery.
System Thinker: You consider architecture, performance, and maintainability when designing AI solutions.
Collaborative by Nature: You’re comfortable working across teams, communicating openly, and solving problems together.
Relevant Background: A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is helpful, but not required if you bring the right experience and mindset.







Our Lean Recruitment Process




30-minute screening call with our recruiter, Christian Payne
1-hour onsite meeting with hiring manager Casper (Chief Data Officer) and Nicolai (Data Product Lead)
1-hour onsite case session, where you'll present a small case to Casper (CDO), Nicolai (Data Product Lead), and have a follow-up conversation with Nikolai (CEO)







Here is the transparency on the dates of our interview stages:

Screening calls take place over 2 weeks - July 28th - August 8th
1st interviews take place in the week of August 11th to August 15th
2nd interviews with case take place in the week of August 18th to August 22nd







If you're excited to build AI that helps nearly 1 million Danes better understand and navigate their personal finances, we’d love to hear from you.

Show more
