Title: Java Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Tech-first. Ego-free. User-obsessed. We’re Skatteguiden – the independent advisor for 1 million Danes (and counting), starting with tax and now taking on the broader world of personal finance.




We’re not tied to strategic partners, investor KPIs or slow-moving hierarchies. We're profitable, well-funded, and accountable only to our users. That gives us a rare superpower: clarity.




We’re a tech company at heart. That means tight teams, direct execution, and continuous delivery. We build fast, break well, and learn obsessively. We ship meaningful products, not fluff – and we win together.







About The Team

The Development Team currently consists of 10 developers: 7 backend and 3 frontend specialists.




Skatteguiden has recently transitioned from a classic development team to a squad structure.

You will join one of three squads, each with a focus on a specific product or service.




Squads are composed of 3-4 developers who participate in tasks assigned within their squad. These are autonomous squads—developers decide on and prioritise the tasks that need to be implemented.







About The Role

You will have a crucial responsibility for driving and implementing the technological development of Skatteguiden's app. Ensuring a seamless and engaging user experience for hundreds of thousands of active users.




Curiosity and a willingness to acquire and share knowledge are essential for both your future success and that of the company.




You will contribute to prioritising tasks and shaping the product roadmap within an autonomous and agile team environment.




In addition to these qualities, it would also be advantageous if you:

Design, develop, and maintain high-quality Java applications using Spring Boot to support Skatteguiden’s digital tax platform
Collaborate closely with cross-functional squad members, including frontend developers, product managers, and UX designers, to deliver seamless user experiences
Implement and optimise database interactions using MySQL to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval
Develop and maintain asynchronous communication between services using RabbitMQ or similar message brokers
Containerise applications with Docker to ensure consistent deployment across environments
Participate in code reviews, testing, and continuous integration to maintain code quality and reliability
Proactively identify opportunities to improve system performance, scalability, and security
Contribute to technology decisions and process improvements within the squad and the wider development team
Share knowledge and mentor team members to foster a collaborative and learning-focused environment
Deliver features and fixes in a fast-paced, agile environment, ensuring timely releases and real-time user impact







Your Experience

Expert-level proficiency in Java and Spring Boot with a proven track record of building complex, scalable applications
Strong experience with MySQL and relational database design, optimisation, and querying
Hands-on experience with RabbitMQ or similar message brokers for asynchronous service communication
Proficient in using Docker for containerization and managing consistent development and deployment environments
Skilled in version control using GIT, including branching, merging, and collaborative workflows
Ability to work effectively in autonomous, cross-functional squads with a focus on delivering user-facing features in real time
Demonstrated curiosity and eagerness to learn and share knowledge within a fast-paced, tech-driven environment
Experience contributing to technology choices and process improvements in a flat organisational structure is a plus







What's In It For You?

Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where adaptability and quick decision-making are valued and encouraged




Be part of a small, close-knit product team that values honesty, open communication, and continuous learning




Contribute to meaningful products that simplify complex financial and tax matters for hundreds of thousands of users, making a tangible impact on their daily lives




Benefit from a supportive culture that balances responsibility with stability—live out your entrepreneurial ambitions without sacrificing a steady salary and life balance




Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including UI/UX experts and data specialists, fostering a holistic approach to product development and customer experience




Opportunity for professional growth and development in a scale-up environment that embraces innovation and values your proactive mindset







Our Technology Stack

We strive to always utilise the best and most secure technologies. Our technology stack is therefore constantly evolving, allowing us to stay ahead of the opportunities that new technologies can offer.




Curious to know our tech stack? Here it is!




Development (Frontend):

Codepush
Redux RTX
TypeScript
React-Native




Development (Backend):

S3 storage
OpenAPI
NodeJS
Docker
RabbitMQ
MongoDB
MySQL
Java (Spring Boot)




Operations:

GHCR
GitHub Actions
OpenTelemetry
Loki
Promtail
Prometheus
Grafana
ArgoCD
Kubernetes







Our Tools

We continually improve our way of working and select only the tools that we believe are best suited to us at any given time.




Among others, these include:

Linear for project management
Figma for UI/UX and prototyping
GitHub as a code repository and for code review
Sentry for logging







Our Lean Recruitment Process

1) 30-minute screening call with our recruiter, Christian Payne

2) 1-hour meeting with the technical team lead and senior developers to assess technical skills and team fit

3) Final onsite meeting for 1-hour

Show more
HTML:
Tech-first. Ego-free. User-obsessed. We’re Skatteguiden – the independent advisor for 1 million Danes (and counting), starting with tax and now taking on the broader world of personal finance.


We’re not tied to strategic partners, investor KPIs or slow-moving hierarchies. We're profitable, well-funded, and accountable only to our users. That gives us a rare superpower: clarity.


We’re a tech company at heart. That means tight teams, direct execution, and continuous delivery. We build fast, break well, and learn obsessively. We ship meaningful products, not fluff – and we win together.



About The Team

The Development Team currently consists of 10 developers: 7 backend and 3 frontend specialists.


Skatteguiden has recently transitioned from a classic development team to a squad structure.

You will join one of three squads, each with a focus on a specific product or service.


Squads are composed of 3-4 developers who participate in tasks assigned within their squad. These are autonomous squads—developers decide on and prioritise the tasks that need to be implemented.



About The Role

You will have a crucial responsibility for driving and implementing the technological development of Skatteguiden's app. Ensuring a seamless and engaging user experience for hundreds of thousands of active users.


Curiosity and a willingness to acquire and share knowledge are essential for both your future success and that of the company.


You will contribute to prioritising tasks and shaping the product roadmap within an autonomous and agile team environment.


In addition to these qualities, it would also be advantageous if you:

  • Design, develop, and maintain high-quality Java applications using Spring Boot to support Skatteguiden’s digital tax platform
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional squad members, including frontend developers, product managers, and UX designers, to deliver seamless user experiences
  • Implement and optimise database interactions using MySQL to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval
  • Develop and maintain asynchronous communication between services using RabbitMQ or similar message brokers
  • Containerise applications with Docker to ensure consistent deployment across environments
  • Participate in code reviews, testing, and continuous integration to maintain code quality and reliability
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve system performance, scalability, and security
  • Contribute to technology decisions and process improvements within the squad and the wider development team
  • Share knowledge and mentor team members to foster a collaborative and learning-focused environment
  • Deliver features and fixes in a fast-paced, agile environment, ensuring timely releases and real-time user impact



Your Experience

  • Expert-level proficiency in Java and Spring Boot with a proven track record of building complex, scalable applications
  • Strong experience with MySQL and relational database design, optimisation, and querying
  • Hands-on experience with RabbitMQ or similar message brokers for asynchronous service communication
  • Proficient in using Docker for containerization and managing consistent development and deployment environments
  • Skilled in version control using GIT, including branching, merging, and collaborative workflows
  • Ability to work effectively in autonomous, cross-functional squads with a focus on delivering user-facing features in real time
  • Demonstrated curiosity and eagerness to learn and share knowledge within a fast-paced, tech-driven environment
  • Experience contributing to technology choices and process improvements in a flat organisational structure is a plus



What's In It For You?

Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where adaptability and quick decision-making are valued and encouraged


Be part of a small, close-knit product team that values honesty, open communication, and continuous learning


Contribute to meaningful products that simplify complex financial and tax matters for hundreds of thousands of users, making a tangible impact on their daily lives


Benefit from a supportive culture that balances responsibility with stability—live out your entrepreneurial ambitions without sacrificing a steady salary and life balance


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including UI/UX experts and data specialists, fostering a holistic approach to product development and customer experience


Opportunity for professional growth and development in a scale-up environment that embraces innovation and values your proactive mindset



Our Technology Stack

We strive to always utilise the best and most secure technologies. Our technology stack is therefore constantly evolving, allowing us to stay ahead of the opportunities that new technologies can offer.


Curious to know our tech stack? Here it is!


Development (Frontend):

  • Codepush
  • Redux RTX
  • TypeScript
  • React-Native


Development (Backend):

  • S3 storage
  • OpenAPI
  • NodeJS
  • Docker
  • RabbitMQ
  • MongoDB
  • MySQL
  • Java (Spring Boot)


Operations:

  • GHCR
  • GitHub Actions
  • OpenTelemetry
  • Loki
  • Promtail
  • Prometheus
  • Grafana
  • ArgoCD
  • Kubernetes



Our Tools

We continually improve our way of working and select only the tools that we believe are best suited to us at any given time.


Among others, these include:

  • Linear for project management
  • Figma for UI/UX and prototyping
  • GitHub as a code repository and for code review
  • Sentry for logging



Our Lean Recruitment Process

1) 30-minute screening call with our recruiter, Christian Payne

2) 1-hour meeting with the technical team lead and senior developers to assess technical skills and team fit

3) Final onsite meeting for 1-hour

Title: Junior Data Analyst & Scientist – Bliv bindeleddet mellem data og forretning
Description:
Er du vild med data og nysgerrig på, hvordan tal og analyser kan skabe værdi i en virksomhed? Har du lyst til at kickstarte din karriere i en rolle, hvor du får lov at prøve kræfter med både analyse, samarbejde og forretningsforståelse? Så har vi måske jobbet til dig!

Lige nu leder vi efter en Junior Data Analyst til vores Marketing-team – en rolle, hvor du får masser af ansvar, læring og mulighed for at udvikle dig i krydsfeltet mellem forskellige afdelinger og stakeholders.

Hvad går jobbet ud på?

Du bliver en del af vores Marketing Data Insights-team, hvor vi hjælper forretningen med at træffe de rigtige beslutninger baseret på data. Du får chancen for at arbejde tæt sammen med både Product Marketing, Digital Marketing og andre nøglefunktioner.

Vi leder ikke efter én med mange års erfaring – vi leder efter dig, der har mod på at lære og har lyst til at bruge dine tekniske evner i en mere kommerciel kontekst. Vi sørger for, at du får den oplæring og sparring, du har brug for, så du kan vokse i rollen.

Når du er kommet godt ind i jobbet, vil du bl.a. arbejde med:


Supplier Management & Analyse: Understøtte Product Marketing med værktøjer, statistik og KPI-overvågning for vores leverandører. Du sikrer, at vi har styr på leverandørpræstationer, bonusberegninger og kontraktstatus.



Kampagneanalyse & Digital Marketing:

Evaluere og analysere marketingkampagner og bidrage med optimeringsforslag. Opbygge dashboards og datarutiner, der sikrer transparens og forbedret beslutningsgrundlag.


Projektledelse: Drive og koordinere projekter på tværs af Marketing og øvrige afdelinger, herunder budgetarbejde, sortimentsvalg og systemintegrationer.
Data & Systemudvikling: Være med til at videreudvikle og vedligeholde vores dataprocesser.



Hvem er du?

Du behøver ikke have mange års erfaring – det vigtigste for os er, at du:


Har en relevant uddannelse inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence eller lignende
Har arbejdet med SQL, Python eller lignende programmeringssprog og har et ønske om at blive endnu dygtigere på området
Har erfaring med databaser og Cloud (Google Cloud, Power BI eller lign.)
Har superbrugerkompetencer i Excel
Evt har erfaring med analyse, dataflows og performance management – gerne i en kommerciel kontekst
Er flydende engelsk i skrift og tale



Og vigtigst af alt: Du har lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vi tør prøve nyt, hjælper hinanden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Hvad får du hos os?


En plads i en international virksomhed.
Mulighed for både faglig og personlig udvikling.
Fantastiske kolleger og en stærk social kultur.
Svanemærket kantine og god kaffe.
Sundheds- og tandforsikring, pension og personaleforening.



Læs mere om os her

Klar til at tage det første skridt?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst, hvor du fortæller, hvorfor du vil arbejde hos os. Ansøgningsfristen er d. 18. august 2025.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Dennis Rømer Jensen, Head of Marketing Data Insights på telefon 23331102 eller e-mail dennis.jensen@lyreco.com. (ferie frem til 14. juli 2025.)

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hos Lyreco ønsker vi at fremme ligestilling og mangfoldighed. Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksuel orientering eller handicap.

Lokation Roskilde


Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:

  • Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
  • Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
  • Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
  • Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger

Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

requisitionid:13178

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Place: Hillerød Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Machine Learning Scientist




FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled machine learning scientist with a strong background in deep learning to develop our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.




This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSS’ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately better global usage of limited resources.










Primary tasks




Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for the data chain. You will work in close collaboration with our hardware and software teams as well as marketing organization in taking the data chain from concept to deployment and sales release. In this task, you will be responsible for:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets.
Develop algorithms and data pipelines.
Design experiments to test the data chain.
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets.
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms.




Your daily work will be at the FOSS innovation center in Hillerød, Denmark.







About you




You hold an M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:

Extensive hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Proficient in data science methodologies, including experimental design, statistical analysis, and hypothesis testing, using tools such as Python, Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
Experience in machine learning development best-practices and MLOps workflows.
Good understanding of image processing, with practical use of libraries such as OpenCV.
Familiar with optimizing deep learning models for efficient deployment on edge devices and resource constrained environments is a plus.
Previous industry experience in applied machine learning projects is considered an advantage.




We expect you to have an interest in

the full data chain of analytical instruments.
developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers.
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain.










As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You’re curious about new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting, incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open-minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.







We offer




We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D. Foss is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strives at delivering cutting-edge creative algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal and humorous tone.




Application




Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, but due to summer vacation in Denmark, the hiring process will start in week 31! Any questions can be directed to head of machine learning Erik Schou Dreier esd@foss.dk (please note there may be a slight delay in response due to vacation).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief.




FOSS

FOSS contributes to the sustainable use of our planet’s agricultural resources and thus to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We make it our business to build analytical solutions, which add value by improving food quality and optimizing production, from raw material to finished products.

FOSS helps optimize the use of food and agricultural resources by enabling customers to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste, better quality, bigger yields, and more optimal use of raw materials.

Always at the forefront of analytical technology development, FOSS provides a range of analytical solutions from laboratory to at-line and in-line solutions, across industries from dairy to grain and meat.

FOSS provides instruments and solutions to the world’s 100 largest food companies and for more than 60 years, FOSS has been innovating analytical technology.

FOSS was founded by Nils Foss in Hillerød in 1956. We are a family-owned, global company and our products and services are sold all around the world. FOSS employs more than 1,500 highly qualified people worldwide.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

  • Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
  • Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.

About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

requisitionid:20868

Title: Associate AI Engineer
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Studied Software Development or Data Science – do you want to become an Associate AI Engineer?

Would you like to join us as we scale our AI team? You have finished your studies want to start your career by bringing the right AI tools to the business to create value.

Join us as we identify the AI models and solutions, we configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

”Bringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, you’ll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose,” says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a relatively new AI team. The team is responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

“This area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. We are working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally – and growing our team along the way,” explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplast’s strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions, setting up agents, configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails


Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation




Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to test our AI models and make sure we create the best solutions.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you


Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration from your studies or work
Have worked in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments as part of your studies or work
Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages from your studies or work
Have knowledge of access management and infrastructure as code
Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Are fluent in English
Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

Title: Engineering Internship
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Overview

At Shure Scandinavia, we offer internships within different engineering disciplines and we are always on the outlook for talented students, who are passionate about their field of study.

As an intern at Shure, you will be part of the professional team of developers who are passionate about technologies, innovation and product quality. We are eager to share knowledge and to learn from each other - both locally and with our colleagues in the US, India, Scotland and China.

Inclusion, trust and respect for one another is at the core of our robust company culture, and we have a dynamic and open work environment with lots of opportunities for learning and development. Our workplace is inspiring, flexible, and informal with ample possibilities for learning and growth. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.

Responsibilities

Embedded Software

If your passion lies within C, C++ and Python, we can offer you a challenging internship during which you will contribute to the development of new product features and solutions including task estimation, design, implementation and documentation. Our embedded software department spans the globe and you will be part of a knowledgeable team of professional developers.

Application Software

Are you into working with HTML5, CSS, .net, and JavaScript as well as frameworks such as AngularJS and Material Design, then you can as a part of your internship contribute to developing great functionalities to Shure’s growing portfolio of software applications.

Digital Signal Processing

As an intern within Digital Signal Processing, you will be given assignments within design, simulation, development and test of real time audio signal processing algorithms for fixed-and-floating-point DSPs. Also, you will be making simulations in Matlab and Simulink as well as using C, C++ and DSP assembly languages.

FPGA

An internship within FPGA and Integrated Circuits Design will include design and coordination of FPGA circuits with use of VHDL for implementation of core signal processing and control elements as well as interfaces to other hardware. In addition hereto, you will be doing circuits test and analysis.

DevOps

If you like automation, you can help Shure to deliver faster by automating repetitive tasks. In DevOps, we help teams deliver firmware, software and data by streamlining our build set-up. We use Jenkins, Git (Bitbucket), Python 3.4+, Linux and Docker as well as PostgreSQL and Windows, and we visualize data using Grafana that enables our colleagues to make data driven decisions.

System Verification

Do you believe artificial intelligence and machine learning are the way forward for automation? Then we can offer you a challenging internship where you will be part of a team that strives to use automation for collecting data points to evaluate the health of our products and ecosystems on a global level.

Qualifications

Your profile and application:

As a person, you are focused and have an eye for detail. You see opportunities in the challenges that occur during your work day you and you enjoy collaborating with team members from different parts of the world. Shure is a global company and we have many talented developers who are always ready to review and discuss new ideas, methods and solutions. Ignite the pure power of engineering: Join Shure and have a great internship.

At Shure, in addition to practical experience, you receive salary during your internship.

When you apply, please tell us why you are interested in an Internship at Shure and remember to include an overview of the courses - including grades - you have completed. Pleae also include information on when you expect to start your internship according to your studies.

Title: Character AI Programmer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced AI Programmer who will be responsible for supporting the development and implementation of AI in our animation team. This position will create systems and features that enhance the work of our animators and will be a key interface with the wider programming team.

You should be willing to work at the Playdead office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

What will I be doing?





Designing and developing new AI systems and features to aid action setup, navigation and interaction between characters in an open world.


Create custom scenarios in collaboration with the animation team
Develop debug tools to help our animators when needed
Engage with the wider programming team to ensure we develop sustainable, optimised and stable functionality.


What We Would Like To See





Professional experience working with AI development and tooling


Deep technical experience and competence working with C++ and Unreal engine
You have developed and released at least 1 AAA game
You have a collaborative spirit and work to solve problems as a member of the wider production team


We are open minded about the technologies we deploy and always open to consider new options to solve emerging challenges.

Who We Are

Playdead is an independent game developer based in Copenhagen, Denmark. We are the creators and publishers of LIMBO and INSIDE. Our current project is a 3rd person, open world, science fiction adventure built for multiple platforms on Unreal Engine, published by Epic Games Publishing.

Our legacy and ambition is to make games with an uncompromising attention to detail. Our approach to development is experimental, iterative and collaborative. We are particularly interested in friendly, talented people who feel confident taking charge of their own schedule.

We are currently more than 100 creative professionals and still looking to grow.

Learn more about us at www.playdead.com

Title: Do we need you in Denmark and we don't even know it yet?
Description:
Job Description

Thank you for visiting Better Collective. We're happy to know that you want to join our team and take part in our journey to become the leading digital sports media group. We always like to hear from you and if you did not find your dream job among our open positions do not hesitate to send us an unsolicited application.

Please apply in English. We only accept and process applications via our online recruitment system, so please apply using the "Apply" button. Should we afterwards post your dream job make sure to apply directly to this job even though you are already in our candidate database.

Job requirements

Be sure to fill in all mandatory fields when applying. Also, please include a description of your motivation for applying with us and describe what you are interested in working with. The more you are able to elaborate on your interests the more we are able to find the right match for you. When you receive a confirmation you can rest assured that we shall contact you if we would like to learn more about you.

Thank you for your time - we really appreciate your interest in Better Collective.

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27380

Are you ready to help shape the future of ML & AI at Scandinavia’s largest bank, working alongside a dynamic, fast-paced team? The Group AI Center of Excellence is an established unit within Group Technology focusing on delivering and enabling ML/AI use cases across the organization. The unit provides reusable ML/AI Assets that are developed in conjunction with business stakeholders to be leveraged by a wide variety of use cases.

We are now looking for an Expert Data Scientist who is interested in working in the field of ML/AI with use-cases across the bank. You will work closely with data scientists, ML engineers, and business stakeholders to take AI applications from concept to production, ensuring they are developed in an ethical, safe, and sustainable way.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to the Data science & Decisioning team. Your passion for working with people from both a technical and a business background, coupled with your curiosity for ML & AI and new innovations like Generative AI, makes you well-suited for this position. As Nordea pioneers its way into an ML/AI and Gen AI driven future, you will thrive by embracing a dynamic environment, fostering collaboration, and maintaining an open and adaptable mindset.

What you will be doing:


As a data scientist, you will help to resolve data-intensive decisioning problems through application of data processing & modelling and contribute to driving intelligent automation through algorithmic & model-based solutions:
Design and build scalable, reliable ML/AI solutions, using existing assets & framework or creating something new from scratch
Collaborate and engage in discussions with stakeholders and colleagues related to requirements, data and methods for data manipulation to resolve broad spectrum of business problems
Ensure our ML/AI applications are developed from idea to production, meeting all necessary requirements for smooth and successful deployment
Engage and incorporate feedbacks by following the internal guidelines coming from model risk validation framework, legal or privacy teams. Engage in optimizing the code for further steps towards model deployment
Stay on top of cutting-edge technologies by exploring and recommending the latest and greatest AI methods, tools and services. Your insights will keep us ahead of the curve!

Our AI team culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning and innovation. We foster an open environment where diverse ideas thrive, encouraging everyone to push the boundaries of technology while supporting each other's growth. With a strong focus on well-being, we prioritize work-life balance and encourage open communication.

At Nordea, inclusion and diversity are at the heart of our values. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, fosters creativity and creates a more supportive workplace for all. The role is based in Høje Taastrup, Helsinki, or Stockholm.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Embrace a growth mindset, where you enjoy taking initiative and bringing solutions
Enjoy problem solving, and tackling challenges
Are an awesome team member and you have a strong ability to inspire and collaborate with people to take action


Your experience and background:


BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, relevant data science field
10+ years of experience in testing, maintaining, launching AI/ML products, working with MLOps best practices and DevOps environment (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, container orchestration)
Experience in training, evaluation, fine-tuning and deployment of predictive models; including feature selection, hyper-parameter tuning, error analysis and data visualisation
You’re a coding wizard in one or more data science programming language i.e. Python, Pyspark, SQL etc., and you know your ways around tools like IBM Watson (CP4D), BitBucket, Hive, Unix Systems, visualization tool such as PowerBI etc.
Experience working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless, ML (e.g., AWS SageMaker), or data storage services as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Skilled at transforming complex ideas into clear, engaging explanations—whether you're presenting to a technical team or breaking things down for non-experts


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 17/08/2025. We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

Title: Data Science & BI Developer
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join our Data & AI team and work hands-on with one of the world’s richest tracking datasets. You’ll be deeply embedded in our baseball data projects, building data models, dashboards, and reporting tools that help coaches, analysts, and athletes make data-driven decisions.

Our team leads both internal and customer-facing BI efforts, turning complex data into meaningful, accessible insights. In addition to BI development, we also explore data science and machine learning solutions that enhance our tracking technology and product offering.

We collaborate closely with tracking and application software teams, as well as the product team, to develop products that are shaping how baseball is played and understood.

Due to the summer holidays, the interview process will start in August.

Example Projects You’ll Work On:


Dashboards to detect anomalies across thousands of Baseball tracking devices
BI reports to monitor player performance across stadiums
Data modeling to translate tracking metrics into coaching-friendly visualizations
Tools to support internal operations with reliable, scalable reporting.


Your Profile:

You might be experienced – or you might be just starting your career—but what matters most is that you are:


Motivated, proactive, and a fast learner
Curious about working with complex data
Excited by the idea of building high-quality BI tools that have a real-world impact
Eager to grow in an international, collaborative, and sports-driven environment


You have some hands-on experience with SQL and dashboards (Power BI or similar), and you’re comfortable working with data from pipelines to final reports. You're practical, outcome-oriented, and you enjoy translating numbers into actionable insights.

Responsibilities:


Build and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports
Develop and optimize data models and schemas
Collaborate with data engineers to acquire and prepare data
Work with product owners and internal stakeholders to define BI needs
Support operations and customer-facing teams with data-driven tools


Requirements


A background in a data-related field (can be academic or hands-on experience)
Experience writing SQL and working with relational databases
Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools (school or project experience counts!)
A proactive, independent approach – you enjoy owning your tasks and learning as you go
Fluent in English and comfortable working in a cross-cultural team
Bonus if you have a passion for baseball or experience working with sports data


The Office

We have just moved to our state-of-art HQ in Hørsholm, located at DTU Science Park. We take great pride in the building we designed! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness centre, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with an indoor and outdoor area to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work.

Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Seoul and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion!

For additional information about the position, please contact Hind Sghyer, Data & AI Team Lead: hind.sghyer@trackman.recruitee.com.

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application as soon as possible.

Apply now
Show more

Our team leads both internal and customer-facing BI efforts, turning complex data into meaningful, accessible insights. In addition to BI development, we also explore data science and machine learning solutions that enhance our tracking technology and product offering.

We collaborate closely with tracking and application software teams, as well as the product team, to develop products that are shaping how baseball is played and understood.

Due to the summer holidays, the interview process will start in August.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Are you excited about the intersection of fashion and cutting-edge technology? Do you want to be part of an innovative and forward-thinking tech division within one of the world’s leading fashion companies?

At BESTSELLER TECH, our mission is to blend advanced technology with the fashion industry, creating ground-breaking solutions that drive our business forward. We are on an ambitious mission to revolutionize B2B customer interactions in the fashion world through advanced AI technologies — and we’re now looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our new AI Fashion Recommendations team.

YOUR TEAM 

Our new AI Fashion Recommendations team is at the forefront of developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for some of BESTSELLER’s most strategically important projects. Our goal is ambitious: to ensure we provide personalised recommendations for all wholesale customers anticipating their needs, to ensure BESTSELLER is the best possible vendor for them. Our work has a high focus on delivering value to our brands and we are working in a hypothesis-driven manner to always test out ideas and directly measure the impact of our solutions.

YOUR JOB 

As our new Senior Data Scientist, you’ll be part of shaping AI-powered experiences across BESTSELLER’s wholesale landscape. Your main tasks will include:


Developing and implementing advanced machine learning models for fashion recommendations, including customer and product models for efficient and personalized recommendations
Analysing large datasets to extract meaningful insights and inform recommendation strategies
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver effective AI solutions
Continuously researching and staying updated on the latest AI and machine learning technologies relevant to fashion forecasting
Presenting complex data and recommendations in a clear and understandable manner to stakeholders
Supporting the development of a Customer Data Platform that empowers our sales organisation with data-driven insights.


Your Benefits


A unique opportunity to be at the forefront of developing AI products and drive the data discipline in the next phase of our AI journey
You will experience an organisation that is on the forefront of working agile to drive innovation and deliver high-quality solutions efficiently
You will experience a manager who has great confidence and trust in you and your abilities and who gives you the opportunity to develop.


YOUR PROFILE 

If you’re passionate about creating value from machine learning applications, we’d love to hear from you! We're looking for someone with strong communications skills, excellent problem-solving abilities who pays attention to details.

Other qualifications to succeed in the role are: 


A Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or a related field
3-5 years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer
Strong experience in deep learning and recommender systems
Strong programming skills in Python or R
Experience with Databricks
Fluency in English, both spoken and written.


CURIOUS FOR MORE? 

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH by following #bestsellertech on LinkedIn. 

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU 

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Jakob Blaavand on +45 21 68 49 41. Otherwise, please send us your application as soon as possible and no later than 5 August 2025.  We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad when we find the right candidate. 

Location: Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Radiobotics we are looking for a new member of our development team, an experienced Software Engineer to help our efforts in scaling our infrastructure and product deployments. You will be working with AI driven products for automation of medical image analysis.

Who We Are

We are on a mission to transform radiology by designing ML/DL based products that augment the workflow of radiologists, improving the quality of the diagnosis and reducing waiting time. We are developing algorithms for automatic analysis and description of routine medical x-ray images at hospitals, within musculoskeletal radiology. We have a beautiful office in central Copenhagen where we like to work, go for a swim in the harbor in the summer before/after work and enjoy each others’ company.

Who You Are

You probably have a background in software engineering or a similar topic, though your technical skills together with your ability to learn very fast, work independently and collaboratively are what really matters.

Since we are a small team, a new member will have to fit well into our group and our informal mentality. You should be open to work on a wide range of tasks from our office in Copenhagen.

Your main responsibility in Radiobotics will be designing the software architecture of our products and implementing it. This entails integrating deep learning models, developed by our deep learning engineers, into a product environment, implementing communication interfaces using the DICOM protocol, generating graphical outputs automatically as well as designing and running verification tests for the products. Furthermore you will be tasked with handling scaling and deployment of products in various environments, including the cloud.

Being a small company we all wear many hats and we also expect you to bring your experience building software to improve and bring a fresh perspective to the way we work in development team.

After 2 weeks...

You’ll already know all your new colleagues, who does what within Radiobotics, and who can help you out when you feel lost. Moreover, you will have enjoyed a few delicious breakfasts and Friday bars. You’ll be up and running with the hardware and software you need to code and be familiarized with our documentation and processes. You have already made and reviewed a few pull requests.

After 3 months...

You’ll be working on new features for our products and tools and fixing some bugs. You will have had 1:1 meetings with almost everyone from Radiobotics and your latte art game will be on point. You’ll be leading you own projects, writing PRs and collaborating in the design of the production backbone of Radiobotics. You will have participated in a few social activities outside the office and have your personal ranking of your favorite almond croissants in the city.

After 6 months...

By this date, you won’t be the RBrookie anymore, so you’ll be the lead in some projects and will be co-authoring the way we work, develop infrastructure and deploy products at Radiobotics. Your work will most likely be already in use by radiologists, technological partners and the rest of the company. Depending on the timing, you’ll have attended a hackathon/work-away and you will have developed competitive Foosball/Petanque skills you didn’t know you had.

What We Expect From You


You have 3+ years of software design and development experience
You have excellent knowledge of at least one general-purpose programming language, preferably Python
You have experience working with Docker & containerised applications
Good general experience in software engineering and software architecture
You know your way around in Linux
You have experience designing tests and working with CI/CD
You are skilled in explaining and presenting analyses and concepts to a broad technical audience writing good code and implementing patterns where they apply
You have ownership and responsibility of the parts of the project you implement/lead
You’re positive, driven, and a fast learner


Nice To Have


Some experience with Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud
Some experience with programming languages for high performance computing (e.g. C++, Go)
Experience working with software as a medical device
Front-end experience and/or web-technologies
Show more
