Title: Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)
Description:
Denmark

Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)

Organization


UN High Commissioner for Refugees


Posted 24 Jul 2025 Closing date 7 Aug 2025

Deadline for Applications

August 7, 2025

Terms of Reference

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is offering a full-time internship with the Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section of the Global Data Service (GDS) in Copenhagen, Denmark. UNHCR is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for asylum seekers, refugees, returnees, internally displaced communities and stateless people.

Access to reliable, timely, relevant and accurate data on these populations is essential to enhance their protection and support the achievement of durable solutions. The Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section develops statistical definitions and standards and oversees the production of global statistics on refugees and other populations of concern to UNHCR. The Agency’s Data Transformation Strategy 2020-2025 aims to position UNHCR as a trusted leader on data and information related to refugees and other populations of concern.

The internship is based in Copenhagen with GDS’ Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section (SDSS). The intern will join the Secretariat of the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), work under the direct supervision of the Head of the Secretariat and in close collaboration with other secretariat colleagues and units within SDSS.

Title: Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)

Duty Station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 6 months (with possible 2-month extension)

Contract Type: Internship

Start date: 01 October 2025

Organizational context

Increasingly, UNHCR’s data efforts rely on joint engagements with partners to better achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement. As part of these efforts, UNHCR has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a Steering Committee member and through hosting its Secretariat. The EGRISS currently consists of 61 countries and 38 international and regional organisations.

The EGRISS was established in 2016 by the UN Statistical Commission to develop recommendations on refugee and IDP statistics and produce guidance for their implementation at country level. The International Recommendations on Refugee (IRRS) and IDP (IRIS) Statistics were endorsed in 2018 and 2020, respectively, and implementation work is ongoing through advocacy, capacity building, and further methodological development. Most recently, the International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) have been endorsed by the UN Statistical Commission in 2023. All three sets of recommendations aim to contribute to the improvement of official statistics on the identified populations produced through the national statistical systems of affected countries.

A central focus of EGRISS’ third mandate (2020-2025) concerns capacity development which is pursued through regional engagement, technical support, guidance provision and online learning. The Secretariat also invests in monitoring the application of the international statistical recommendations by countries and institutions alike to feed into annual reporting processes. During the period 2020-2024, over 253 concrete examples of implementation have been identified. In 2023, the EGRISS Secretariat has revised its implementation monitoring system, launching it as Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey improving the quality of the data it collects, and the insights that can be drawn from analysis of collected data. In following years, Secretariat has conducted annual evaluations of GAIN survey, to further improve scope and coverage of monitoring progress made by countries and international organizations to pursue statistical inclusion of refugees, IDPs and stateless persons. Implementation of identified improvements in GAIN 2025 round, will enable more precise identification of best practices, upcoming activities, enhance knowledge dissemination, inform peer-to peer learning and future improvements of the recommendations.

The position

We are seeking an intern to assist the EGRISS Secretariat in a range of activities with a focus on in the revision and implementation of the EGRISS GAIN survey and management of the associated monitoring database that tracks the application of international recommendations. As an intern, you will work closely with the EGRISS Secretariat staff and relevant EGRISS members to ensure the successful planning, execution, and reporting of the GAIN survey. The internship will provide you with hands-on experience in survey design, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

Duties and responsibilities


Support EGRISS monitoring & evaluation activities, including updates and implementation of EGRISS Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey:
Assist in the updates to GAIN survey questionnaire, based on lessons learned from the evaluation process, questionnaire translation in survey languages, update of survey protocols, including a pilot test for 2025 round of the survey
Help implement survey schedule and logistics plan
Assist in identification of additional focal points from national statistical systems to enhance the scope of GAIN 2025 survey and obtain necessary permissions and clearances to include them in the 2025 data collection
Participate in pre-survey briefings with institutional respondents (e.g., regional EGRISS partners, national and global institutions with large number of examples) for coordinating dissemination
Help conduct the GAIN 2025 survey as per the updated and approved methodology and protocols
Assist respondents with any additional information during data collection to ensure adherence to protocols
Support follow up interviews with selected respondents to complete GAIN survey dataset
Help compile and organize the collected data
Assist in cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy and completeness
Assist in analysing the data using appropriate statistical techniques
Help prepare GAIN survey results based on identified tables needed for EGRISS annual and supplemental reporting, workplans of technical sub-working groups, regional engagement and other dissemination efforts
Help update other dissemination tools, like GAIN survey dashboards and infographics.
Assist in disseminating the report to stakeholders
Document lessons learned and best practices through 2026 round of GAIN survey evaluation
Assist in preparing an annual archive of implemented documents, datasets, and reports
Other duties as assigned
Support the implementation of other EGRISS activities possibly including:
Annual Report, including development of case studies.
Research, analysis or editorial work related to ongoing methodological papers on topics such as identification questions for household surveys or measuring progress towards durable solutions for IDPs.
Support organization and coordination of meetings, documentation of decisions and actions agreed and necessary logistical arrangements.
Support the effective implementation of EGRISS Secretariat’s responsibilities.


Minimum Qualifications Required

In order to be considered for an internship, candidates must meet the following eligibility criteria:


Be either a recent graduate (having completed their studies within two years of


applying) or a current student in a graduate/undergraduate school programme from a university or higher education facility accredited by IAU/UNESCO1; and


Have completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of UNHCR.
not have exhausted the maximum cumulative internship period with UNHCR, including any prior internships (8 months for full-time and 12 months for part-time)


NOTE: An individual who bears the relationship of parent, child or sibling or step-parent, step-child or step-sibling to a current UNHCR staff member or affiliate is not eligible for an internship.

Required Experience And Competencies


Fluency in English language
The intern has displayed an interest in and comprehension of official statistics (and/or operational data) from a variety of sources, such as surveys, administrative data, census data, operational data, big data, and other types of data.
Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Interest to pursue career in humanitarian/development action, forced displacement, migration or related field.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with statistical software (e.g., SPSS, Stata, R, Pyhton)
Experience with data visualization software (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau)
Ability to work independently and in a team setting
Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines


Desirable Qualifications And Skills


Have completed university degree (BA) of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of EGRISS, in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Economics, International Relations, Social Science or any other related field
Knowledge of survey methodology and data analysis techniques is a plus
Knowledge of another UN language such as French, Spanish, Russian or Arabic is an asset


Conditions

It is a full-time role with working hours starting from 8.30am to 5:00pm Monday to Friday (40 hours per week). The successful candidate will be assigned to support the team in Copenhagen and must be available to work full-time for the duration of the internship.

Allowance: Interns who do not receive financial support from an outside party will receive an allowance to partially help to cover the cost of food, local transportation and living expenses.

Travel: Unless provided or paid by external sponsoring entities, UNHCR reimburse interns engaged from a location outside of the country of the duty station for the ticket costs of their outward and return travel to/from the duty station by the most economical route available on economy class, irrespective of the duration of the journey. Reimbursement shall be limited to the authorized outward and return travel between the intern’s country of residence and the intern’s duty station, or actual route of travel, whichever is lower.

How to apply

Interested applicants should submit their application through www.unhcr.org/careers.html

Obligations

Acquiring and renewing current visas, residence permits including all associated costs, obtaining medical certification and compliance with taxation requirements (if applicable), are the responsibility of the intern. However, the office can assist interns with the initiation of the visa process.

The selected candidate will need to provide UNHCR with a proof of health insurance coverage applicable to the assigned internship location and a certificate of good health from a qualified medical practitioner certifying their fitness for work and travel. In the event the selected candidate is not able to produce the required certificates, they will not be admitted to the Internship Programme.

If you are a person with a disability and you expect you may face challenges during the recruitment process, you can indicate it in your application form.

There are options to select any health conditions you may have and outline any necessary adjustments related to disabilities during the recruitment phases. Providing this information is optional. It will be treated as strictly confidential and used only for the purpose of finding out how to better assist you during the recruitment process.

Adjustments for candidates with disabilities will be provided as best as possible and as needed upon request.

All candidates will be assessed based on meeting the requirements for each vacancy in relation to experience, skills, and education.

The UNHCR workforce consists of many diverse nationalities, cultures, languages and opinions. UNHCR seeks to sustain and strengthen this diversity to ensure equal opportunities as well as an inclusive working environment for its entire workforce. UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing or training.

We welcome applications from candidates with a refugee or stateless background.

HTML:
Denmark

Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)

Organization

  • UN High Commissioner for Refugees

Posted 24 Jul 2025 Closing date 7 Aug 2025

Deadline for Applications

August 7, 2025

Terms of Reference

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is offering a full-time internship with the Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section of the Global Data Service (GDS) in Copenhagen, Denmark. UNHCR is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for asylum seekers, refugees, returnees, internally displaced communities and stateless people.

Access to reliable, timely, relevant and accurate data on these populations is essential to enhance their protection and support the achievement of durable solutions. The Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section develops statistical definitions and standards and oversees the production of global statistics on refugees and other populations of concern to UNHCR. The Agency’s Data Transformation Strategy 2020-2025 aims to position UNHCR as a trusted leader on data and information related to refugees and other populations of concern.

The internship is based in Copenhagen with GDS’ Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section (SDSS). The intern will join the Secretariat of the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), work under the direct supervision of the Head of the Secretariat and in close collaboration with other secretariat colleagues and units within SDSS.

Title: Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)

Duty Station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 6 months (with possible 2-month extension)

Contract Type: Internship

Start date: 01 October 2025

Organizational context

Increasingly, UNHCR’s data efforts rely on joint engagements with partners to better achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement. As part of these efforts, UNHCR has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a Steering Committee member and through hosting its Secretariat. The EGRISS currently consists of 61 countries and 38 international and regional organisations.

The EGRISS was established in 2016 by the UN Statistical Commission to develop recommendations on refugee and IDP statistics and produce guidance for their implementation at country level. The International Recommendations on Refugee (IRRS) and IDP (IRIS) Statistics were endorsed in 2018 and 2020, respectively, and implementation work is ongoing through advocacy, capacity building, and further methodological development. Most recently, the International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) have been endorsed by the UN Statistical Commission in 2023. All three sets of recommendations aim to contribute to the improvement of official statistics on the identified populations produced through the national statistical systems of affected countries.

A central focus of EGRISS’ third mandate (2020-2025) concerns capacity development which is pursued through regional engagement, technical support, guidance provision and online learning. The Secretariat also invests in monitoring the application of the international statistical recommendations by countries and institutions alike to feed into annual reporting processes. During the period 2020-2024, over 253 concrete examples of implementation have been identified. In 2023, the EGRISS Secretariat has revised its implementation monitoring system, launching it as Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey improving the quality of the data it collects, and the insights that can be drawn from analysis of collected data. In following years, Secretariat has conducted annual evaluations of GAIN survey, to further improve scope and coverage of monitoring progress made by countries and international organizations to pursue statistical inclusion of refugees, IDPs and stateless persons. Implementation of identified improvements in GAIN 2025 round, will enable more precise identification of best practices, upcoming activities, enhance knowledge dissemination, inform peer-to peer learning and future improvements of the recommendations.

The position

We are seeking an intern to assist the EGRISS Secretariat in a range of activities with a focus on in the revision and implementation of the EGRISS GAIN survey and management of the associated monitoring database that tracks the application of international recommendations. As an intern, you will work closely with the EGRISS Secretariat staff and relevant EGRISS members to ensure the successful planning, execution, and reporting of the GAIN survey. The internship will provide you with hands-on experience in survey design, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Support EGRISS monitoring & evaluation activities, including updates and implementation of EGRISS Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey:
  • Assist in the updates to GAIN survey questionnaire, based on lessons learned from the evaluation process, questionnaire translation in survey languages, update of survey protocols, including a pilot test for 2025 round of the survey
  • Help implement survey schedule and logistics plan
  • Assist in identification of additional focal points from national statistical systems to enhance the scope of GAIN 2025 survey and obtain necessary permissions and clearances to include them in the 2025 data collection
  • Participate in pre-survey briefings with institutional respondents (e.g., regional EGRISS partners, national and global institutions with large number of examples) for coordinating dissemination
  • Help conduct the GAIN 2025 survey as per the updated and approved methodology and protocols
  • Assist respondents with any additional information during data collection to ensure adherence to protocols
  • Support follow up interviews with selected respondents to complete GAIN survey dataset
  • Help compile and organize the collected data
  • Assist in cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy and completeness
  • Assist in analysing the data using appropriate statistical techniques
  • Help prepare GAIN survey results based on identified tables needed for EGRISS annual and supplemental reporting, workplans of technical sub-working groups, regional engagement and other dissemination efforts
  • Help update other dissemination tools, like GAIN survey dashboards and infographics.
  • Assist in disseminating the report to stakeholders
  • Document lessons learned and best practices through 2026 round of GAIN survey evaluation
  • Assist in preparing an annual archive of implemented documents, datasets, and reports
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Support the implementation of other EGRISS activities possibly including:
  • Annual Report, including development of case studies.
  • Research, analysis or editorial work related to ongoing methodological papers on topics such as identification questions for household surveys or measuring progress towards durable solutions for IDPs.
  • Support organization and coordination of meetings, documentation of decisions and actions agreed and necessary logistical arrangements.
  • Support the effective implementation of EGRISS Secretariat’s responsibilities.

Minimum Qualifications Required

In order to be considered for an internship, candidates must meet the following eligibility criteria:

  • Be either a recent graduate (having completed their studies within two years of

applying) or a current student in a graduate/undergraduate school programme from a university or higher education facility accredited by IAU/UNESCO1; and

  • Have completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of UNHCR.
  • not have exhausted the maximum cumulative internship period with UNHCR, including any prior internships (8 months for full-time and 12 months for part-time)

NOTE: An individual who bears the relationship of parent, child or sibling or step-parent, step-child or step-sibling to a current UNHCR staff member or affiliate is not eligible for an internship.

Required Experience And Competencies

  • Fluency in English language
  • The intern has displayed an interest in and comprehension of official statistics (and/or operational data) from a variety of sources, such as surveys, administrative data, census data, operational data, big data, and other types of data.
  • Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Interest to pursue career in humanitarian/development action, forced displacement, migration or related field.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Experience with statistical software (e.g., SPSS, Stata, R, Pyhton)
  • Experience with data visualization software (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau)
  • Ability to work independently and in a team setting
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines

Desirable Qualifications And Skills

  • Have completed university degree (BA) of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of EGRISS, in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Economics, International Relations, Social Science or any other related field
  • Knowledge of survey methodology and data analysis techniques is a plus
  • Knowledge of another UN language such as French, Spanish, Russian or Arabic is an asset

Conditions

It is a full-time role with working hours starting from 8.30am to 5:00pm Monday to Friday (40 hours per week). The successful candidate will be assigned to support the team in Copenhagen and must be available to work full-time for the duration of the internship.

Allowance: Interns who do not receive financial support from an outside party will receive an allowance to partially help to cover the cost of food, local transportation and living expenses.

Travel: Unless provided or paid by external sponsoring entities, UNHCR reimburse interns engaged from a location outside of the country of the duty station for the ticket costs of their outward and return travel to/from the duty station by the most economical route available on economy class, irrespective of the duration of the journey. Reimbursement shall be limited to the authorized outward and return travel between the intern’s country of residence and the intern’s duty station, or actual route of travel, whichever is lower.

How to apply

Interested applicants should submit their application through www.unhcr.org/careers.html

Obligations

Acquiring and renewing current visas, residence permits including all associated costs, obtaining medical certification and compliance with taxation requirements (if applicable), are the responsibility of the intern. However, the office can assist interns with the initiation of the visa process.

The selected candidate will need to provide UNHCR with a proof of health insurance coverage applicable to the assigned internship location and a certificate of good health from a qualified medical practitioner certifying their fitness for work and travel. In the event the selected candidate is not able to produce the required certificates, they will not be admitted to the Internship Programme.

If you are a person with a disability and you expect you may face challenges during the recruitment process, you can indicate it in your application form.

There are options to select any health conditions you may have and outline any necessary adjustments related to disabilities during the recruitment phases. Providing this information is optional. It will be treated as strictly confidential and used only for the purpose of finding out how to better assist you during the recruitment process.

Adjustments for candidates with disabilities will be provided as best as possible and as needed upon request.

All candidates will be assessed based on meeting the requirements for each vacancy in relation to experience, skills, and education.

The UNHCR workforce consists of many diverse nationalities, cultures, languages and opinions. UNHCR seeks to sustain and strengthen this diversity to ensure equal opportunities as well as an inclusive working environment for its entire workforce. Applications are encouraged from all qualified candidates without distinction on grounds of race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing or training.

We welcome applications from candidates with a refugee or stateless background.

In the education section of the application, please make sure that your school is selected from the list of accredited higher education institutions when creating a profile in UNHCR Recruitment Portal - Workday. To do this, click on the magnifying glass next to Select School, then select Contains next to Description, type in the name of the school, click Look up and finally click on the result.

How to apply

Please apply here before 07 August 2025 23:59 (CEST).

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Chemical Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bring more to life.

Do you want to seize the unique opportunity of being part of a growing MedTech company with a product within one of the most complicated technologies?

Meet Radiometer

At Radiometer, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.

Our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses. As a global leader and pioneer in acute care diagnostics for over 70 years, we streamline diagnostic workflows, empowering healthcare professionals to focus on what truly matters—caring for critically ill patients. We’re a team that celebrates diverse ideas and continuous improvement. Here, you’ll find a place to grow and make a real impact with your unique perspective, driving us forward in improving patient care.

Meet your department

In the position as Chemical Engineer, you are the vital link between R&D and Operations, and work with implementing improvements on existing production lines as well as designing new production lines.

The team is characterized by a high level of professionalism and technical expertise, spanning engineering, technical, and operational disciplines. We value everyone’s contribution and foster a culture of mutual respect, support, and shared responsibility—because we believe that every employee truly makes a difference.

This position reports to the Senior Manager of Manufacturing Development, is part of a larger section called Projects, NPI & Manufacturing Technology, and is located in Brønshøj.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:


Lead implementation and ensure compliance with, e.g., IVDR regulation
Build expertise in the chemistry used for our Blood Gas Analyzers and take responsibility for the tasks related to chemical processes in our projects
Validate test methods and processes
Partner with cross-functional teams and internal stakeholders such as R&D, production, QA and RA
Troubleshoot and resolve process and measurement issues, offering technical support to operations
Learn and apply Lean methods


The essential requirements of the job include:


Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, or related field.
Min. 2 years of experience working in the field of production incl. working knowledge of laboratory processes
Min. 2 years of experience from a regulated industry, such as medical devices, with a good understanding of GMP, and validation requirements
Effective planning, coordination and communication skills
Professional working level in English and Danish


It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:


Working and navigating in projects involving several functions and many stakeholders
Efficiently prioritize tasks and easily switch focus between multiple projects


Application

We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in your application. There may be delays due to the summer holidays, but we encourage you to apply before end of business on 27th July 2025. However, the position is filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. If you have questions, feel free to contact Senior Manager, Manufacturing Development, Robert Hoffmann at robert.hoffmann@radiometer.dk

We look forward to seeing your application.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

Danaher

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Title: Project Specialist Food Systems
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about food systems? And is it your dream to be part of a team driving philanthropy within global development and humanitarian support?

We are looking for a Project Specialist for the Global Development department in the Health Area at the Novo Nordisk Foundation.

The Department of Global Development in Novo Nordisk is responsible for partnerships in low-middle income countries, focused on reducing health inequities of vulnerable people and communities affected by fragility, crisis and climate change. We do this via collaboration with UN, civil society, governments, other philanthropies and academia within areas of prevention and management of CMDs and promotion of sustainable agro-food systems.

The Department of Global Development sits in the Health Area dedicated to making a positive impact towards a healthier future for all.

The Health Area is led by Chief Scientific Officer, Professor Flemming Konradsen, and consists of about 60 colleagues who are passionate about advancing and improving equity in the prevention and management of cardiometabolic diseases, infectious diseases and other key health outcomes. We focus on research, innovation, implementation, health economics, and policy analysis. We are committed to fostering international partnerships within health and in improving nutritional outcomes, food security and local food systems in low- and middle-income countries and humanitarian settings.

The job

As Project Specialist your key tasks will be:


Support team members with project and partnership development, monitoring and evaluation within the broader food systems transformation portfolio in collaboration with different external and internal stakeholders
Support analytical and data-driven exercises
Support design of programmes to ensure synergies in implementation, innovation and research with other workstreams
Support team members with developing novel work tracks, for example sustainable financing models, climate and food systems, home grown school feeding, etc
Support team members in preparing advocacy initiatives and communication activities


You will be based at the Novo Nordisk Foundation headquarters in the Copenhagen area; however, you must be able to travel occasionally.

Professional And Personal Qualifications

We are looking for a project specialist who is highly motivated to contribute to global development and food systems transformation in low- and middle-income countries. You have a master's degree or PhD. in international development, economics, political science, behavioral science, nutrition, food or agri-food systems, or a related field. In addition, formal training in systems-thinking will be considered an advantage.

Preferably, you also have 2-3 years' relevant experience from working with NGOs, government programmes or similar where you have contributed to development or implementation of initiatives that aim to transform food systems. As this is a junior position, senior level applicants will not be considered.

We imagine you have:


Proven project management skills
Experience working at the intersection between sustainable and healthy diets/nutrition and agrifood systems
Previous experience with applied and/or interdisciplinary research projects is desirable
Previous work experience in a field position in low- and middle-income countries context is desirable


As a person, you are:


Proactive, independent and able to provide input on issues relating to administration, project design, project monitoring, project management and communication
Ambitious and with a structured approach to problem-solving
Intellectual quickness, curiosity, discipline, resourcefulness and resilience
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build good relationships
Strong ability to work as a team member


Working at the Novo Nordisk Foundation

We offer a committed and professional workplace in which we emphasize ensuring that our colleagues thrive, are challenged, and have opportunity to develop their potential. A career at the Novo Nordisk Foundation gives you the opportunity to work: 


on important projects that improve people's health and the sustainability of society and the planet.
with key actors within research and development in Denmark and internationally.
and as part of a dedicated team that is passionate about creating impact


Application and Information

To apply, please send your CV, cover letter, university transcripts and other relevant documents by clicking the "Apply now" button.

We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than 27 July 2025. We expect first interviews to be held medio August.

About The Novo Nordisk Foundation

Established in Denmark in 1924, the Novo Nordisk Foundation is an enterprise foundation with philanthropic objectives. The vision of the Foundation is to improve people's health and the sustainability of society and the planet. The Foundation's mission is to progress research and innovation in the prevention and treatment of cardiometabolic and infectious diseases as well as to advance knowledge and solutions to support a green transformation of society. 

In the coming years, the Foundation will broaden its scope and increase its grants for scientific, humanitarian, and social purposes, including solving the climate crisis and developing tomorrow's food production. As a consequence, we are a growing organisation which means new job openings and exciting opportunities for employees to be part of forming the future of the Foundation.
Show more

The job

As Project Specialist your key tasks will be:

  • Support team members with project and partnership development, monitoring and evaluation within the broader food systems transformation portfolio in collaboration with different external and internal stakeholders
  • Support analytical and data-driven exercises
  • Support design of programmes to ensure synergies in implementation, innovation and research with other workstreams
  • Support team members with developing novel work tracks, for example sustainable financing models, climate and food systems, home grown school feeding, etc
  • Support team members in preparing advocacy initiatives and communication activities

You will be based at the Novo Nordisk Foundation headquarters in the Copenhagen area; however, you must be able to travel occasionally.

Professional And Personal Qualifications

We are looking for a project specialist who is highly motivated to contribute to global development and food systems transformation in low- and middle-income countries. You have a master's degree or PhD. in international development, economics, political science, behavioral science, nutrition, food or agri-food systems, or a related field. In addition, formal training in systems-thinking will be considered an advantage.

Preferably, you also have 2-3 years' relevant experience from working with NGOs, government programmes or similar where you have contributed to development or implementation of initiatives that aim to transform food systems. As this is a junior position, senior level applicants will not be considered.

We imagine you have:

  • Proven project management skills
  • Experience working at the intersection between sustainable and healthy diets/nutrition and agrifood systems
  • Previous experience with applied and/or interdisciplinary research projects is desirable
  • Previous work experience in a field position in low- and middle-income countries context is desirable

As a person, you are:

  • Proactive, independent and able to provide input on issues relating to administration, project design, project monitoring, project management and communication
  • Ambitious and with a structured approach to problem-solving
  • Intellectual quickness, curiosity, discipline, resourcefulness and resilience
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build good relationships
  • Strong ability to work as a team member

Working at the Novo Nordisk Foundation

We offer a committed and professional workplace in which we emphasize ensuring that our colleagues thrive, are challenged, and have opportunity to develop their potential. A career at the Novo Nordisk Foundation gives you the opportunity to work: 

  • on important projects that improve people's health and the sustainability of society and the planet.
  • with key actors within research and development in Denmark and internationally.
  • and as part of a dedicated team that is passionate about creating impact

Application and Information

To apply, please send your CV, cover letter, university transcripts and other relevant documents by clicking the "Apply now" button.

We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than 27 July 2025. We expect first interviews to be held medio August.

About The Novo Nordisk Foundation

Established in Denmark in 1924, the Novo Nordisk Foundation is an enterprise foundation with philanthropic objectives. The vision of the Foundation is to improve people's health and the sustainability of society and the planet. The Foundation's mission is to progress research and innovation in the prevention and treatment of cardiometabolic and infectious diseases as well as to advance knowledge and solutions to support a green transformation of society. 

In the coming years, the Foundation will broaden its scope and increase its grants for scientific, humanitarian, and social purposes, including solving the climate crisis and developing tomorrow's food production. As a consequence, we are a growing organisation which means new job openings and exciting opportunities for employees to be part of forming the future of the Foundation.

Title: Research Engineer for Hydraulic Prototype Testing
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Introduction

At Everllence, we tackle big challenges posed by climate change. We design two-stroke engine combustion technology for large ocean-going merchant vessels, and our technology contributes significantly to the decarbonization of the shipping industry.

All fuel injection and valve actuation on our world leading marine propulsion engines is driven by extremely fast and powerful hydraulic systems, and new engine designs usually require development of new hydraulic and injection components and systems. If you thrive in an environment of fast paced technology development and share our passion for decarbonizing the shipping industry, the position as Research Engineer could be your next career step.

You will play an important role in:


Participating in testing on our rigs in Copenhagen as well as full scale prototype engine tests at our licensees, typically in Japan and South Korea. Tests are carrie out to validate system functionality and identify the optimal parameter settings, e.g., for new hydraulic exhaust valve actuation systems or injection systems
Collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders and departments, sharing knowledge and experience to contribute significantly to the success of new technology development
Delivering control parameters for the engine control system (ECS)
Participating in design reviews
Participate in component and system troubleshooting and root cause analyses (RCA)
Work at our Research Center in Copenhagen, with 40-80 travel days per year, typically at our licenses in Japan and South Korea


We imagine that you:


Have an engineering degree in mechanical engineering, marine engineering or equivalent qualifications
Have experience in one or more of the following fields: fluid mechanics and hydraulics, mechatronics, experimental testing and instrumentation, operation or design of large marine engines, data analysis
Have hands-on skills and enjoy working in an experimental and test-lab environment
Are a team player, structured in your work and possess strong communication skills
Are curious to learn new things and open to new ideas
Are proactive and positive in nature and self-driven in your work


Welcome to Hydraulic Prototype Testing

You will join the Hydraulic Prototype Testing Department within the functional area Hydraulics and Injection Development which is responsible for developing fuel injection/admission concepts and design prototypes for fuel equipment, hydraulic components and systems. The team is testing new components and systems, in particular fuel injection systems and exhaust valve actuation. We test on both physical real-sized test-rigs and on prototype engines including measurements, data analysis,

Documentation, and feedback. In our Research Center Copenhagen (RCC), we have a dedicated hydraulic prototype testing facility including a workshop, where we build-up new test-rigs and run test campaigns in a controlled environment. There is an excellent collaboration, both within the team and cross-functionally, where everyone is committed to succeeding as a team by being supportive and flexible. The working environment is informal, where we cherish the space for creativity and freedom to play with new ideas.

What can you expect from us:

We offer a great place to grow your skills and be part of exciting projects. You’ll get access to modern tools and technologies, and we’ll support you with professional training to help you learn and improve. You’ll work in a collaborative and innovative environment where your ideas matter and your work makes a real difference.

Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At Everllence, we offer you the chance to shape the future where you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions, while achieving your personal career goals. We prioritize work-life balance with flexible working hours, and over 7 weeks of paid time off.

We foster a creative and inclusive culture, emphasizing diversity and equality. We are dedicated to our employees' well-being, offering opportunities to join various social activity clubs, ranging from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

In 2027, we will consolidate our Zealand locations into one large site in Trekroner, Roskilde.

About Everllence

Everllence, formerly known as MAN Energy Solutions , is a leading provider of propulsion, decarbonization and efficiency solutions for shipping, the energy economy and industry. True to our motto – ‘Moving big things to zero’ – we help key industries in the global economy to reduce hard-to-abate emissions. Our technologies have a measurable impact on the success of the global energy transition. More information about the company can be found at www.everllence.com .

Headquartered in Germany, Everllence employs around 15,000 people across more than 140 sites worldwide. In Denmark, we have over 2,500 dedicated employees from more than 55 nationalities, spread across four locations: Copenhagen, Brøndby, Frederikshavn, and Holeby. Our after-sales brand, Everllence PrimeServ, also supports our customers through its worldwide service-center network.

Build your own Future

Please submit your application to us no later than Friday the 1st August 2025. Due to summer holidays, we will conduct interviews during and after the application deadline.. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Department Manager Jakub Rypinski by phone +45 23 27 46 76.

Relocating to Denmark is a major step for our international colleagues. To support this transition, we offer tailored intercultural and global mindset training for all employees and managers, promoting a collaborative and inclusive work environment. Our mobility package includes assistance with obtaining a Danish CPR number, tax information, and work permits,

At Everllence, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: Sensory Assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Sensory Assistant

In our team, we work with how Carlsberg's products are perceived with the senses. We use sensory assessment in connection with quality control, product development and major commercial projects. We have an expert panel that assesses the quality of our products daily. It is in connection with this function that we are looking for an assistant.

What You’ll Be Doing

Your primary tasks and responsibility include/Specifically, your key responsibilities are:


The sensory assistant will be responsible for the following tasks:
Preparing and cleaning of the daily sensory session
supporting the panel leader in logistics and serving samples during the session
coordinating all in and outgoing shipments
responsible for the laboratory (from stock to maintenance coordination and cleaning)
We are looking for a person who can work in a structured way, is detail-oriented, handles planned changes effectively and time constraints, and has a pragmatic approach.
We are a small but international team, so it is important that they can communicate in English and have knowledge of Microsoft office.
Heavy lifting can occur in connection with unpacking and registration of products.

What We’re Looking For

We are looking for a part-time (0,6 FTE, 5 days, 25 hours per week) colleague with a self-motivated approach, who can oversee a lot of manual topics at the same time. Who is a good team player, with supporting team members but also encourage when needed.

What You Can Expect

In Carlsberg, we are brewing for a better today and tomorrow and what we can offer you is an equal opportunity to grow across our company.

All of this is taking place in culturally diverse environment, where we celebrate our successes together and where no matter where you are from, who you are, or what experiences you bring to the table, all we say is: WELCOME YOU!



If you join our team, some of the benefits you’ll enjoy are:


Annual bonus based on company and individual performance
Unlimited soft and coffee drinks in the office
Monthly beer and soft drink allowance
Well-equipped and comfortable office in the heart of Carlsberg City District in Valby, Copenhagen
Opportunities to have fun together during regular Friday


Interested?

Apply through the link. Please notice that this is the only way we accept applications.

The deadline for applying is the 29th of July. We read applications continuously, and vacancies may be filled sooner than the deadline, so we encourage you to apply as early as possible.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Please note: All resumes must be submitted in English. Applications with resumes in other languages will not be considered.

Carlsberg Group: Brewing for a better today and tomorrow

For us success has always been in the diverse mix of our people, our beers and our brands. At Carlsberg, we want to recruit and develop people with a global mindset, cultural understanding, and international experience to ensure that our organization stays agile, inclusive and prepared for future growth. Only by acknowledging and harvesting from different perspectives and experiences, will we gain competitive advantage and leverage the effect of diversity for business growth. Carlsberg aims to create equal access to opportunity regardless of social identity, and we encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, nationality, race, religion or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
The role

As a software engineer at PSQR you will become a part of a highly skilled team. PSQR favour above all the relevancy of technical solutions coming from the team: the hierarchy is flat, and the process of decision making is collaborative – we strive towards choosing good solutions no matter who came up with them.




We are a diverse team of international employees working together at our head office located in the city centre of Copenhagen.




Your profile

We are looking for a candidate with an innovative and solution-oriented approach who can think creatively in complex situations. You are a team player who naturally collaborates across various disciplines and thrives on achieving results together with your colleagues.




Succeeding in a position at PSQR isn’t about a specific set of tools or a fixed process. Instead, it’s your mindset, dedication, and ability to see opportunities rather than limitations that will be key to your success.




You have solid experience with Java development and knowledge with some of the tech stacks mentioned below:

Java
React
Linux
Docker
Cassandra/ScyllaDB
MySQL/MariaDB
RabbitMQ
ElasticSearch
ZooKeeper




Your task and responsibilities:

Develop and maintain backend systems: build, optimise, and maintain backend services for secure supply chain traceability, ensuring scalability and performance
Integrate external systems: Integrate into APIs for external systems, or develop supplemental APIs in the solution for external systems to connect, to secure data-sharing protocols to maintain data integrity and enhance traceability
Extend front-end and mobile components: Extend the web UI or mobile application with additional functionality to serve the needs of the customers
Debug, test, and optimise codebase: identify and resolve software bugs, write tests to ensure code accuracy, and optimise performance
Enhance system security: conduct security audits, manage vulnerabilities, and implement best practices to maintain a secure platform
These are the core tasks that emphasise PSQR’s focus on secure, reliable, and collaborative software development







PSQR is offering

A diverse team of international employees, representing 13 different nationalities, working together at our head office in the city centre of Copenhagen.

A flat organisation, promoting open communication. The employees are empowered to contribute directly, focusing on collaboration and results over titles. This structure creates an agile, dynamic workplace where everyone’s input is valued.

They foster a relaxed, open environment for creativity and open communication, while maintaining high standards in delivering quality work




Application and contact

Randstad manages the recruitment process on behalf of the company. If the position has caught your interest, please apply for the role through this site.




For more detailed information regarding this position, please contact Chief Consultant Kasper Kjærgaard on +45 61 95 92 51. All inquiries will be handled confidentially.




About PSQR

PSQR is a Danish software development company that specialises in providing highly scalable software for storing, processing, and analysing vast amounts of traceability data to industry- as well as government customers. The software is modular and extensible which allows PSQR and our software integration partners to bring it into play for any product vertical all the way from raw materials, through processing, to finished goods, and finally recycling – establishing the complete traceability circle.




About Randstad

Randstad is the world’s largest talent company and a partner of choice to clients. As a Partner for Talent, we are committed to providing equitable opportunities to people from all backgrounds and helping them remain relevant in the rapidly changing world of work.




We have a deep understanding of the labour market and help our clients to create the high-quality, diverse and agile workforces they need to succeed. We support people to realise their true potential throughout their entire working life. This is what we do and what motivates us every day.




Randstad DK is part of the international Randstad Group. Every day, we help more than 600,000 people around the world find jobs. We specialise in finding, attracting, and retaining skilled talent to power businesses at speed and at scale. Randstad DK is a leader in this field, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, Aalborg, and Kolding.

Title: Metallurgist
Description:
Job Description

Join us in shaping the future of energy

Are you a Metallurgist driven by complex challenges and real-world impact? At NOV Flexibles, we are expanding our Metallurgy Technology Centre to support global operations—from Kalundborg, Denmark to Porto de Açu, Brazil. We’re looking for an analytical, collaborative engineer to push the boundaries of corrosion science and materials technology in offshore environments.

Join a multidisciplinary team where your expertise will influence every phase of our product lifecycle—from early design to field installation.

At NOV, we deliver safe, high-quality, technology-driven equipment, services, and support that are essential to the global energy industry. Our mission is simple: we power the industry that powers the world.

At NOV’s business unit Subsea Production Systems (SPS) we empower the energy sector with passion, expertise, and forward-thinking solutions. We develop reliable and efficient subsea energy production products that enhance our customers’ energy portfolios. With strong roots in the offshore oil and gas industry, we are also at the forefront of future technologies such as water treatment, ammonia storage, carbon injection, and wind energy—helping to reduce CO₂ emissions and drive the energy transition.

SPS is headquartered in Brøndby, Denmark, with production sites in Kalundborg (DK), Porto do Acu (Br), Glenrothes (UK) and offices in Stavanger and Oslo (No), Rio de Janeiro ( Br), and Houston (US). Globally, our team includes around 1,500 dedicated professionals, contributing to NOV’s workforce of approximately 34,000 employees.

What We Offer


A collaborative environment with highly skilled experts
Influence across international projects and production sites
Access to an advanced in-house laboratory
A role central to offshore innovation and energy transition
A culture that values technical excellence, curiosity, and continuous learning


Key Responsibilities


Investigate corrosion and fatigue mechanisms (e.g., pitting, SCC, SSC)
Plan and conduct laboratory tests with technical staff
Analyze and present test findings to internal stakeholders
Advise on material selection and corrosion control strategies
Collaborate with suppliers and production teams to resolve technical challenges
Maintain and improve technical procedures and specifications


Essential

Qualifications & Skills


Degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Materials Science
Strong understanding of corrosion and electrochemistry in steels
Proficiency in interpreting technical results and procedures
Fluent in English


Desired


Experience with electrochemical testing or offshore materials
Familiarity with relevant standards (e.g., NACE, ASTM)


Soft Skills

Success in this role requires a structured, proactive mindset and strong communication skills. You should thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy translating complex technical findings into actionable insights.

Why Join Us?

We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where growth, innovative thinking and continuous improvement are core to how we operate. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally through diverse and challenging assignments, supported by experienced colleagues and a culture that values learning and development.

Joining NOV means becoming part of a purpose-driven organization that is committed to operational excellence, sustainability, and long-term career progression.

With us at NOV Subsea Production Systems you’ll have an important role in delivering reliable and efficient subsea solutions, meeting today’s energy demands and shaping a more sustainable future.

Join us in going beyond to shape the future of energy. Because energy matters.

About Us

Every day, the oil and gas industry’s best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.

We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success—now and in the future.

Global Family

We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.

Purposeful Innovation

Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.

Service Above All

This drives us to anticipate our customers’ needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.

About The Team

Corporate

Our family of companies is supported by our global Corporate teams, providing expert knowledge from functions including Human Resources, Information Technology, Compliance, Finance, QHSE, Marketing and Legal centers of expertise. We are structured to provide guidance and service above all to all our business operations.

At NOV’s business unit Subsea Production Systems (SPS) we empower the energy sector with passion, expertise, and forward-thinking solutions. We develop reliable and efficient subsea energy production products that enhance our customers’ energy portfolios. With strong roots in the offshore oil and gas industry, we are also at the forefront of future technologies such as water treatment, ammonia storage, carbon injection, and wind energy—helping to reduce CO₂ emissions and drive the energy transition.

SPS is headquartered in Brøndby, Denmark, with production sites in Kalundborg (DK), Porto do Acu (Br), Glenrothes (UK) and offices in Stavanger and Oslo (No), Rio de Janeiro ( Br), and Houston (US). Globally, our team includes around 1,500 dedicated professionals, contributing to NOV’s workforce of approximately 34,000 employees.

What We Offer

  • A collaborative environment with highly skilled experts
  • Influence across international projects and production sites
  • Access to an advanced in-house laboratory
  • A role central to offshore innovation and energy transition
  • A culture that values technical excellence, curiosity, and continuous learning

Key Responsibilities

  • Investigate corrosion and fatigue mechanisms (e.g., pitting, SCC, SSC)
  • Plan and conduct laboratory tests with technical staff
  • Analyze and present test findings to internal stakeholders
  • Advise on material selection and corrosion control strategies
  • Collaborate with suppliers and production teams to resolve technical challenges
  • Maintain and improve technical procedures and specifications

Essential

Qualifications & Skills

  • Degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Materials Science
  • Strong understanding of corrosion and electrochemistry in steels
  • Proficiency in interpreting technical results and procedures
  • Fluent in English

Desired

  • Experience with electrochemical testing or offshore materials
  • Familiarity with relevant standards (e.g., NACE, ASTM)

Soft Skills

Success in this role requires a structured, proactive mindset and strong communication skills. You should thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy translating complex technical findings into actionable insights.

Why Join Us?

We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where growth, innovative thinking and continuous improvement are core to how we operate. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally through diverse and challenging assignments, supported by experienced colleagues and a culture that values learning and development.

Joining NOV means becoming part of a purpose-driven organization that is committed to operational excellence, sustainability, and long-term career progression.

With us at NOV Subsea Production Systems you’ll have an important role in delivering reliable and efficient subsea solutions, meeting today’s energy demands and shaping a more sustainable future.

Join us in going beyond to shape the future of energy. Because energy matters.

About Us

Every day, the oil and gas industry’s best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.

We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success—now and in the future.

Global Family

We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.

Purposeful Innovation

Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.

Service Above All

This drives us to anticipate our customers’ needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.

About The Team

Corporate

Our family of companies is supported by our global Corporate teams, providing expert knowledge from functions including Human Resources, Information Technology, Compliance, Finance, QHSE, Marketing and Legal centers of expertise. We are structured to provide guidance and service above all to all our business operations.

Title: Experienced CRA - Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Overview

Experienced CRA - Denmark

Perform monitoring and site management work to ensure that sites are conducting the study(ies) and reporting study data as required by the study protocol, applicable regulations and guidelines, and sponsor requirements.

Essential Functions


Perform site monitoring visits (selection, initiation, monitoring and close-out visits) in accordance with contracted scope of work and Good Clinical Practice.
Work with sites to adapt, drive, and track subject recruitment plan in line with project needs to enhance predictability.
Administer protocol and related study training to assigned sites and establish regular lines of communication with sites to manage ongoing project expectations and issues.
Evaluate the quality and integrity of study site practices related to the proper conduct of the protocol and adherence to applicable regulations. Escalate quality issues as appropriate.
Manage the progress of assigned studies by tracking regulatory submissions and approvals, recruitment and enrollment, case report form (CRF) completion and submission, and data query generation and resolution. May support start-up phase.
Ensure copies/originals (as required) site documents are available for filing in the Trial Master File (TMF) and verify that the Investigator's Site File (ISF) is maintained in accordance with GCP and local regulatory requirements.
Create and maintain appropriate documentation regarding site management, monitoring visit findings and action plans by submitting regular visit reports, generating follow-up letters and other required study documentation.
Collaborate and liaise with study team members for project execution support as appropriate.
If applicable, may be accountable for supporting development of project subject recruitment plan on a per site basis.
If applicable, may be accountable for site financial management according to executed clinical trial agreement and retrieve invoices according to local requirement.


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree Degree in scientific discipline or health care preferred.
Requires at least 2 years of year of on-site monitoring experience.
Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be accepted in lieu of degree.
Good knowledge of, and skill in applying, applicable clinical research regulatory requirements.
i.e., Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines.
Good therapeutic and protocol knowledge as provided in company training.
Computer skills including proficiency in use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint and use of a laptop computer and iPhone and iPad (where applicable).
Written and verbal communication skills including good command of Danish and English language.
Organizational and problem-solving skills.
Effective time and financial management skills.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers, and clients.


IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Student Consultant (Graduate programme)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Work Eligibility: EU/EEA citizenship or valid work permit

Part-time / Full-time

Build Your Career – The Y4 Way

As a Student Consultant at Y4, you won’t just shadow, you’ll build, shape, and deliver from day one. Our graduate track is designed for ambitious students, recent grads, or career-switchers who want more than just a line on their CV. You’ll get hands-on experience with real clients, work alongside senior Salesforce experts, and explore how cutting-edge AI and sharp strategic thinking are transforming the consulting landscape.

We're currently hiring across two distinct tracks and welcome you to apply to either (or both, if you’re unsure where you fit yet):

Track 1: Technology & AI

Are you passionate about systems, tools, and how technology can reshape work? In this track, you’ll get exposure to:


Salesforce configuration and solution building
AI agent and prompt engineering
Business process automation
Internal tooling and product prototyping
Collaborating with architects, engineers, and AI specialists


Ideal for: students from tech, engineering, data, or innovation backgrounds who love solving problems with tools and code (no need to be an expert, curiosity and willingness to learn go a long way).

Track 2: Human-Centric Design, Strategy & Analysis

Do you love understanding people, mapping processes, and making things better through insight and structure? In this track, you’ll:


Lead and support client discovery and research
Map user journeys and business processes
Contribute to solution design and user testing
Learn to define “the right problem”, not just the obvious one
Work closely with management consultants, designers, and analysts


Ideal for: students with a business, social science, design, or strategy focus, anyone who wants to use human insight to drive better systems and smarter decisions.

What You’ll Do (Across Tracks)


Contribute to real client projects from week one
Receive coaching, feedback, and certifications from Salesforce veterans
Rotate through AI, advisory, and delivery projects
Grow fast in a safe, supportive environment


What We’re Looking For


Student, recent graduate, or career-switcher with a drive to learn
Tech-savvy or strategically minded, or a mix of both
Curious, communicative, and coachable
Strong problem-solving mindset and written English


What We Offer


A passionate team that always puts customer value first
A laid-back, no-politics culture built on trust, learning, and impact
Career acceleration through real responsibility, mentorship, and leadership tracks
Access to AI innovation and internal IP that sets you apart
Competitive compensation and a fast-growing network of top-tier peers


Why Join Y4?

At Y4, we’re not just building a consultancy, we’re reinventing what consulting can be. You’ll join a team of senior experts, strategists, and innovators who care deeply about doing the right work, not just ticking boxes. Here, you won’t be lost in layers of hierarchy or buried in backlogs, you’ll own meaningful work, shape bold solutions, and help redefine the role of AI in business transformation. Whether you’re a hands-on builder, a sharp thinker, or a future leader, Y4 offers a platform to grow fast, contribute deeply, and be part of a culture that values clarity, trust, and human connection. If you’re ready to build the future of consulting, one smart, impactful project at a time. We’d love to meet you.

Title: Robotics Engineer
Description:
About Robotto

Robotto is a fast-moving software company specializing in AI-driven solutions for autonomous systems. We are building a world-class team dedicated to pushing the limits of robotics and autonomy. Our focus is on developing advanced software that enhances drone capabilities through autonomous flight, AI-powered perception, and robust data integration. Our technology is already making a difference in critical sectors such as wildlife conservation, security, defense, and fire management. By leveraging cutting-edge AI, computer vision, and edge computing, we empower organizations to operate more efficiently and effectively in complex environments.




Our Philosophy

At Robotto, we believe in continuous growth and curiosity. We value people who take initiative, think creatively, and thrive on solving challenging problems. If you enjoy solving complex challenges, experimenting with new methods, and refining your skills through hands-on experience, this is the place for you.




Learning on the go is a big part of the job at Robotto. We encourage you to take what you already have in your toolbox, try new methods, and learn from your mistakes—making Robotto the ultimate workshop for your innovative ideas.




We foster a culture built on trust and boldness, embracing a “forgiveness, not permission” mindset. We encourage you to take risks, challenge norms, and make impactful decisions. If you’re driven by progress and eager to build technology with real-world impact, you’ll feel right at home.




Role Overview – Robotics Engineer

As a Robotics Engineer at Robotto, you will play a vital role in building the core perception and autonomy capabilities for our drone platforms. You will design and implement algorithms for visual odometry, optical flow, and visual SLAM, while working on sensor fusion pipelines to create robust and reliable state estimation and localization. Your work will directly enhance the safety, reliability, and autonomy of mission-critical drone systems deployed in the field.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement robust visual perception algorithms (optical flow, visual odometry, visual SLAM).
Design and integrate multi-sensor fusion strategies combining data from cameras, IMUs, and GNSS.
Optimize perception and estimation pipelines for real-time performance on embedded systems.
Support the development of localization and navigation solutions in GPS-denied environments.
Take part in developing, integrating, and validating robotics software on our drone platforms.
Conduct testing and validation in both simulation and real-world environments.




Required Skills and Experience

Strong software engineering skills with proficiency in modern C++.
Proven experience with visual perception techniques (optical flow, visual odometry, SLAM).
Solid understanding of sensor fusion concepts and practical implementation.
Experience with real-time systems.
Background in estimation theory, dynamic system modeling, or control systems is a plus.
Experience working with drones or other autonomous aerial vehicles is a strong plus.




What Sets This Role Apart

Direct impact on the development of mission-critical autonomous systems.
A passionate, talented team in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Access to training, tools, and resources to accelerate your professional growth.
Opportunity to earn equity through our warrant program.
A mission-driven workplace where technology serves a positive, global purpose.




Why Join Robotto?

At Robotto, you’re not just taking a job — you’re joining a mission. We believe in the power of human–machine collaboration to solve some of the world’s toughest problems. If you want to redefine what’s possible with robotics and autonomy, this is where you belong.




Join Robotto and help crush the boundaries of what’s perceived as achievable!
